title: Durable solutions for Refugee Unaccompanied and Separated Children (Libya and Egypt) and Family Reunification
summary:
The overall objective of this project is to improve protection and expand access to durable solutions for unaccompanied and separated children (UASC) and youth along the Central Mediterranean Route (CMR).

**The specific objective is** to reduce risks associated with secondary movement, trafficking and smuggling of children in Libya and Egypt as well as traditional “first” countries of asylum (Ethiopia and Sudan) through comprehensive child protection interventions including family reunification.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: EU-IOM Joint Initiative in North Africa - Top up to Voluntary Humanitarian Return and Reintegration Assistance
summary: This new Action aims to provide an additional indicative number of 15,000 vulnerable or stranded migrants with voluntarily return assistance. The Action is expected to mainly support voluntary humanitarian returns from Libya to their country of origin. In line with the principles of the EU-IOM Joint Initiative, returning migrants should be provided with access to reintegration support in their countries of origin. For those returning to a country where there is no EU-IOM reintegration project in place, reintegration assistance will also be provided through this project. This represents an estimated percentage of 10% or more (i.e. 1,500 or more) of the number of migrants assisted to return. This Action comes as a top up to the EU-IOM Joint Initiative for Migrant Protection and Reintegration in North Africa and will be implemented by the International Organization for Migration (IOM), under which it is expected that the targeted caseload for voluntary return assistance will be exhausted by the end of 2019 or early 2020 if the current pace of voluntary returns is sustained. Reintegration assistance of migrants returning through this Action to countries in the other two windows of the EUTF (Sahel and Lake Chad and Horn of Africa) as soon as channelled through the Joint Initiative in these two regions if additional funding can be identified.

title: Hand by hand towards better future for migrants and host community in Egypt
summary: Caritas Egypt finds that now is the time for solidarity, for humanitarian assistance and emergency interventions. Through this proposal, Caritas will build on the work done during the past two years, identifying the most vulnerable migrants, refugees and asylum seekers across Alexandria and the north coast governorates. The purpose of this project is to help and assist the targeted families who cannotcover their basic needs and assist them with “monthly cash assistance, winterization and food assistance”as well as to ensure their access to primary, secondary and tertiary health care services. Moreover, the project will offer access to community based organisations (CBOs), youth clubs and cultural venues to enhance social cohesion of the target groups with the hosting community. This component will also be reinforced through advocacy with concerned stakeholders to promote the idea of social cohesion and inclusion. Finally, the project will offer opportunities for self-reliance and economic empowerment for reducing dependency on assistance and aid since the aim of this project is to help the vulnerable families to become resilient, empowered and independent, in order not be a burden on the hosting country, nor on the economic situation, especially in the current context. Caritas will support the livelihood activities by presenting business management trainings, followed with grants, which has a proven impact on refugees and migrants, especially in terms of an improved income situation. Such livelihood interventions can also prepare the persons of concern (POCs) for a potential safe, voluntary and dignified return.

title: Programme d’appui à l’autonomisation et à l’inclusion des populations (PAAIP)
summary: L‟Action est en accord avec la phase III du Programme de Développement et de Protection Régional(RDPP) en Afrique du Nord, et notamment avec son Objectif Stratégique III, puisqu'elle vise à améliorer la protection et la résilience des migrants dans les communautés d'accueil (OG de l’Action) en assurant la protection et les services aux populations vulnérables, y compris les migrants, les réfugiés et lescommunautés d'accueil. L‟Action vise aussi à soutenir l‟accès aux opportunités économiques à travers la promotion du développement de l‟économie locale elle-même, ainsi qu‟à travers la création d‟emploi pour lesmigrants et les communautés d'accueil (OS1). En renforçant les capacités et la collaboration entre lesacteurs locaux, l‟Action vise favoriser la définition des stratégies d‟accès à la fourniture de services de basede qualité au bénéfice de la population locale et des migrants (OS2). En outre, en améliorant les services et en promouvant les actions conjointes entre migrants, OSC et autorités locales, le dialogue social entre les acteurs locaux et la cohésion sociale seront renforcés (OS3).

title: Building Resilience, Inclusion and Social Cohesion in the Fezzan
summary:
In line with the objectives of the EUTF North of Africa (NOA) Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Framework Strategic Objective 3, the action aims to strengthen the resilience and protection of those in need. By fostering employment opportunities and a more business-enabling environment, and by promoting social cohesion among migrants, IDPs, returnees and host communities and facilitating their inclusion and protection, the action will hereby show that migrants, IDPs and returnees can contribute positively to their host communities.

The proposed action will contribute to reach two specific objectives of the EUTF-NOA. The first objective, “_self-sufficiency of target groups and host communities, is enhanced_” will be achieved by generating greater economic and livelihood opportunities and an improved business enabling environment. To do so, ACTED and REACH will provide employability and vocational trainings based on labour market assessments, as well as financial (grants) and technical support (capacity-building) to local economic actors to develop a business-enabling environment with diversified livelihood opportunities. The second objective, “_culture of peace and social cohesion are expanded_” will be achieved through the implementation of awareness-raising activities, improved access to services and by reinforcing the capacities of local service providers involved in the protection and the inclusion of vulnerable populations.
partner_implementing: IMPACT Initiatives, Agence d'Aide à la Coopération Technique et au Développement

title: Promoting Social Cohesion in Libya
summary: The proposed 15-month action brings together the existing presence, expertise and collaboration between Danish Refugee Council (DRC), the International Rescue Committee (IRC) and the Danish Demining Group (DDG) in Tripolitania, to support local communities in Libya to improve their social cohesion by increasing self-reliance and accessing quality services. The Overall Objective is to strengthen protection and resilience of migrants, refugees, IDPs, returnees and host community members in Western Libya.
partner_implementing: IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre, Danish Refugee Council

title: Towards a Holistic Approach to Labour Migration Governance and Labour Mobility in North Africa (THAMM-Enabel)
summary:
THAMM signifie “Vers une approche holistique de la gouvernance des migrations de main-d'œuvre et de lamobilité de la main-d'œuvre en Afrique du Nord”. Le programme ou Action THAMM (Action Document T05 - EUTF-NOA-REG-06) est mis en œuvre conjointement par l’Organisation internationale du Travail (OIT), l’Organisation internationale pour les migrations (OIM), la Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH et l’Agence belge de développement (Enabel), et concerne trois pays d’Afriquedu Nord (le Maroc, la Tunisie et l’Egypte).

Adopter cette approche holistique est essentiel pour maximiser les avantages de la migration et de la mobilité de la main-d'œuvre pour les pays d'origine et de destination ainsi que pour les travailleurs migrantset leurs familles. Le THAMM est conçu en tant que programme régional pour favoriser la migration légale et la mobilité des pays d'Afrique du Nord.L’objectif général du Programme THAMM est de favoriser une migration légale mutuellement bénéfique et la mobilité de main-d’oeuvre, et est atteint grâce à 5 objectifs spécifiques. Alors que l’intervention OIT / OIMvise les objectifs spécifiques 1, 2, 3 et partiellement 5 du Programme THAMM (Action Document T05 - EUTF- NOA-REG-06), les interventions de la GIZ et d’Enabel se focalisent sur l'OS 4 et en partie l'OS 5 du THAMM, à savoir:
OS 4: Des programmes de mobilité sont établis et / ou améliorés.
OS 5: La coopération entre les acteurs concernés dans le domaine de la migration légale et de la mobilité, en particulier le placement, est améliorée.

title: ASSISTANCE AUX PERSONNES MIGRANTES EN SITUATION DE VULNERABILITE AU MAROC: Pour une protection durable des personnes migrantes au niveau régional et national dans le respect de leur dignité
summary: L'action proposée entre en étroite corrélation avec l'objectif principal de l’appel à proposition qui correspond **à l'objectif stratégique 3 du fonds fiduciaire fenêtre Afrique du Nord** ("Renforcer la protection et la résilience des migrants, et des personnes déplacées et des populations hôtes"). Elle est en effet conçue pour offrir des services ensanté mentale, de l’information sur l’accompagnement juridique et une combinaison de services d’urgence aux personnes migrantes les plus vulnérables mais elle vise également la pérennité en s’attachant également à renforcer lescapacités des acteurs opérant au service des personnes migrantes tout en améliorant les mécanismes de concertations multi acteurs et de partage de bonnes pratiques et/ou recommandations avec des actions de plaidoyer au niveau régional et national.

title: ASSISTANCE AUX PERSONNES MIGRANTES EN SITUATION DE VULNERABILITE AU MAROC: PROSAM-Maroc Protection et Santé des Migrants au Maroc
summary:
++**L’objectif global **++est de contribuer au renforcement de la protection des personnes migrantes en situation de vulnérabilité transitant, de manière ponctuelle ou prolongée, par les villes de Rabat, Oujda et ses régions.

Afin de contribuer à l’atteinte de l’objectif général, ++**l’objectif spécifique**++suivant a été défini : **« l’accès et la qualité des services de santé (médico-psycho-sociale) et de protection, adaptés aux besoins spécifiques des personnes migrantes en situation de vulnérabilité, est amélioré ».**

title: Libya COVID-19: Protecting most vulnerable populations from the COVID 19 pandemic in Libya
summary:
The overall objective of the action is to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and to reduce avoidable morbidity and mortality in Libya. This corresponds to EUTF NOA Strategic Objective 3: to strengthen protection and resilience of those in need. This action builds on the previous programming under the EUTF-funded action entitled “Protectingmost vulnerable populations from the COVID 19 pandemic in Libya (T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-12)”, as well as other activities that IMC is currently implementing to respond to the ongoing global emergency caused by COVID-19.

The specific objective is to improve COVID-19 response in Libya through strengthened capacities of Libyan authorities to address COVID-19 and through direct assistance to most vulnerable populations in Libya, in particular (but not exclusively) migrants and forcibly displaced persons. This aligns with EUTF NOA Specific Objective 3.V: Access to and quality of services for target groups and host communities is improved.

title: DIZA – appui transversal
summary:
**L'objectif général** est d'améliorer les conditions de vie des populations hôtes et de réfugiés/retournés dans les zones d’accueil. 

**Les objectifs spécifiques**:

 OS1 : Soutenir l’accès aux services de base et aux mécanismes de protection sociale pour toutes les populations (locales, retournées et réfugiées).  

OS2 : Renforcer la création d'opportunités économiques et d'emplois afin de donner aux populations les moyens de parvenir à l’autosuffisance économique et à la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle.  

OS3 : Renforcer les mécanismes de concertation locale entre populations, autorités locales, secteur privé, services techniques et parties prenantes.

summary:

title: SECurité et GEstion des Frontières (SECGEF)
summary:
**L'objectif général** est de contribuer à renforcer la stabilité au Tchad et l'offre de sécurité comme un bien public de qualité au benefice des populations.

 Les objectifs spécifiques de l'action sont de : 

1. Renforcer le développement des politiques et stratégies de l'Etat en matière de sécurité, notamment en termes de gestion des frontières, avec une attention particulière accordée au respect des droits de l'Homme et des principes et valeurs relatifs à l'Etat de droit. 

2. Renforcer les capacités de fonctionnement et de gestion des structures institutionnelles des FSI, avec une attention particulière attribuée au respect des droits de l'Homme et de normes éthiques minimales y inclus dans le contenu des formations menées. 

3. Accroître la capacité financière des autorités pour maintenir la sécurité intérieure et la stabilité macroéconomique afin d'atteindre les objectifs de la politique nationale de développement à court terme.

title: Programme d’Appui au G5 pour la Sécurité au Sahel (PAGS) Phase II
summary: **L'objectif global** de l’action est de de contribuer à renforcer la sécurité des cinq Etats membres du G5 Sahel (Burkina Faso, Mali, Mauritanie, Niger et Tchad), d’identifier les défis communs auxquels ils doivent faire face et les moyens d’y répondre dans une optique de coopération régionale.

summary:

 L’objectif spécifique est de renforcer la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle des populations les plus vulnérables dans les zones ciblées de Guinée.

**Objectif Spécifique 1**: Améliorer l’accès aux services sociaux de base et renforcer la cohésion sociale au sein des communautés bénéficiaires du projet.

title: Archipelago: an African-European TVET initiative
summary:
ARCHIPELAGO est une initiative africaine et européenne pour la formation professionnelle et entrepreneuriale en Afrique.

Le programme ARCHIPELAGO vise à soutenir la création d'emplois, à la fois qualitatifs et durables, en Afrique centrale et de l'ouest. Il tend ainsi à répondre aux difficultés engendrées sur le continent par l'exclusion économique et sociale, la marginalisation et les situations structurelles d’inégalité, considérées comme les principaux moteurs de la violence, de la radicalisation, du déplacement forcé et de la migration irrégulière.

title: Composante Hydraulique et Assainissement (Pilier 1) pour les zones Nord Tillabéri et Ouest Tahoua au Niger, dans le cadre du PROSEHA
summary:
**L’objectif général** de l'action est celui du PROSEHA, à savoir « garantir l’accès de tous à l’eau et à l’assainissement et assurer une gestion durable des ressources en eau (ODD 6 en 2030) ».  

 Pour atteindre cet objectif général, l'action s’appuiera sur l’objectif spécifique suivant : « contribuer à assurer la disponibilité et la gestion durable de l’eau et de l’assainissement pour tous les usagers de l’espace rural et semi urbain. »   L’objectif spécifique s’insère dans le PROSEHA. Ainsi, l'action contribue à l’atteinte du programme national PROSEHA.

title: « Alliance pour la Cohésion Sociale et la Résilience au Mali et en Mauritanie – lot 1 Fuseau ouest et zones limitrophes » (ACOR)
summary:
**L’objectif général** du projet ACOR est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, la résilience à l’insécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle et face aux conflits et la cohésion sociale des populations vulnérables dans les régions les plus fragiles du Mali et de la Mauritanie.

Pour parvenir à l'objectif global, les **objectifs spécifiques **suivants sont poursuivis:

**Les objectifs spécifiques** sont:

1.  Amélioration de l’accès des ménages et groupes vulnérables aux services sociaux de base, y compris accès aux soins de santé de qualité.
2. Renforcement de la résilience à l’insécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle des populations agricoles et pastorales à travers les moyens d’existence locaux.
3. Renforcement de la capacité des institutions locales, des communautés et des organisations de la société civile à assurer la cohésion sociale, la prévention et réduction des risques.

title: Mediation Communautaire G5 - HD

summary:

Les objectives specifiques de l'action sont:

OS2. Améliorer la gouvernance de la migration et le respect du droit des migrants par les acteurs institutionnels mauritaniens.

title: BMM Phase II
summary: The Overall Objective of the Programme is that national authorities and institutions are able to facilitate safe, orderly and regular migration and effectively address and reduce trafficking in human beings and smuggling of migrants within and from the Horn of Africa region by applying a human rights based approach.

title: Enhancing Job Opportunities and Employability for Youth and Women (EnJOY)
summary: The main activities are public awareness raising events; public employment services (PES) gap assessment, design model one stop job center (OSJC), refurbishment of job centres, capacity building of PES and other government staff, small and micro enterprise (SMEs) needs assessment and assessment of interns’ absorption capacities; improve access to finance, facilitate and implement employment/training schemes; develop and equip business incubation centers (BIC), certified short term training courses relevant to labour market demand and implement trainings through A/TVETs; Investments into A/TVET workshop facilities, business development and cooperative trainings with selected enterprises; increasing existing loan scheme revolving funds through local Saving and Credit Cooperatives (SACCOs).

title: Facility for Migrant Protection and Reintegration in North Africa
summary:
The Action will contribute to reducing the vulnerabilities of migrants along migratory routes across North Africa (NA) through the creation of a “Facility for Migrant Protection and Reintegration in North Africa”. As such, it responds to the EU Trust Fund strategic objective three, namely fostering “improved migration management in countries of origin and transit”. 

Through an innovative and comprehensive approach, the overall objective of the action is to facilitate orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration management through the development and implementation of rights-based, development-based and dignified return and sustainable reintegration policies. IOM asserts that reintegration can be considered sustainable when returnees have reached levels of economic self-sufficiency, social stability within their communities, and psychosocial well-being that allow them to cope with (re)migration drivers. Having achieved sustainable reintegration, returnees are able to make further migration decisions a matter of choice, rather than necessity. To achieve this objective, it is necessary to approach migrant reintegration in a comprehensive and integrated manner, considering the factors that can affect reintegration and addressing them in a way to respond to the needs of the individual returnees as well as the communities to which they return in a mutually beneficial way, and address the structural factors at play. 

​

title: Strengthening decentralized Disaster Risk Reduction Management in Somali and SNNP Regional States -Ethiopia
summary: Ethiopia is one of the countries faced with the challenges posed by disasters resulting from climate changes. The impacts of climate change have resulted in recurrent drought and disasters which in turn resulted in the devastation of livelihoods and food security in the country. As a result, about half of the total woredas in Ethiopia (more than 350 woredas) are considered food insecure woredas, which are being supported through Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP) and in a "normal year" at least 10 million people will depend of food aid to survive.

title: Supporting Libyan authorities to address COVID-19 related challenges and assisting vulnerable groups
summary: In line with the IOM Preparedness and Response Plan for Libya, the **overall objective of this Action is to contribute towards reducing associated morbidity and mortality and enhance protection of the most vulnerable groups affected by the COVID-19, including migrants, IDPs, returnees and host communities.**

title: Strengthening Disaster Risk Reduction Management  in  Amhara Regional State
summary:
**The Overall objective** is to strengthen households, communities and local authorities to manage and adapt to disasters and other risks, thus reducing their vulnerability to crises

**The specific objective **is to enhance the capacities and systems of the Amhara Region to proactively and rapidly help communities cope and be protected in the event of climatic stress and disaster.

title: Strengthening decentralized Disaster Risk Reduction Management in Oromia Regional State - Ethiopia
summary: **Oromia Region** is one of the most populous and resourceful regions in the country, has little considerable history to be categorized with the drought and poverty prone segments of the country.  According to the 2019  HRD documents of emergency responses, in the region, about 3.5 million people are repeatedly exposed to mainly natural hazards causing food deficit every year. Moreover, disaster episodes were increasing from time to time with short periods of cycle particularly aggravated by the impacts of climate change. By the pressing driving forces like climate changes, the frequency and state of natural disaster has become threat for the livelihoods of our community.

title: Libya’s Migration Technical Assistance Facility (LIBMITAF)
summary:
The action “Libya’s Migration Technical Assistance Facility (LIBMITAF)” builds on the momentumcreated during the implementation of the EU-financed project, “Strategic and institutional management of migration in Libya” since August 2016 and the relationship of trust developedbetween ICMPD and the key Libyan institutions working on migration, such as the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA), the National Team for Border Security and Management (NTBSM), the Ministry of Justice (MoJ), the Ministry of Interior (MoI), the Prime Minister Office, the Ministry of Labour (MoL), and others.

Strategic Objective of this action is to strengthen national mechanisms for addressing regular and irregular migration

Specific objectives are:

1. Legislative and institutional frameworks addressing regular and irregular migration are enhanced.

2. Cooperation between relevant stakeholders on regular and irregular migration at international and national level is improved.

title:
Contribution au financement du Secrétariat de la Coalition pour
le Sahel (SCS)
summary:
L’objectif global est d’appuyer la définition et la mise en oeuvre de réponses efficaces et rapides aux phénomènes d’instabilité, d’insécurité, de déficit de développement et de migrations irrégulières dans l’espace sahélien.

Les objectifs spécifiques sont de soutenir la Coalition pour le Sahel, au travers d’un financement de son secrétariat, afin :

OS1 : de renforcer la coordination entre partenaires internationaux

OS2 : d’augmenter l’appropriation par les États sahéliens et le G5 Sahel

OS3 : de promouvoir les actions des partenaires internationaux.

Les résultats attendus sont les suivants :

R1 : L’appui des partenaires internationaux est mieux coordonné et sa redevabilité est renforcée

R2 : Le partage et la circulation de l’information entre partenaires locaux et internationaux est amélioré

R3 : Les actions de la Coalition et de ses membres sont plus visibles et mieux comprises.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Partenariat Opérationnel Conjoint pour la Mauritanie (POC Mauritanie)
summary:
L’objectif global de l'action est de contribuer à lutter efficacement contre le trafic illicite de migrants et d’améliorer les capacités de gestion de l’immigration irrégulière à travers d’un appui intégral aux forces de sécurités mauritaniennes. 

 Les objectifs spécifiques et ses résultats sont les suivants : 

OS.1. Renforcer les capacités d’investigation policière et judiciaire contre les réseaux criminels liés au trafic illicite de migrants et la traite des êtres humains. 

Résultats :

R.1.1 : Un POC est créé et basé à Nouakchott, et devient pleinement opérationnel

R.1.2 : Les capacités techniques d’investigation des membres de la police mauritanienne en matière de lutte contre le trafic illicite de migrants et la traite des êtres humains sont renforcées, en coordination avec les autorités judiciaires.

R.1.3 : Les capacités de surveillance et patrouille sont améliorées à travers la dotation d’équipement spécifique.

OS.2. Améliorer les capacités structurelles et opérationnelles de gestion de l’immigration irrégulière. 

Résultats :

R.2.1 Les bâtiments publics destinés à l’accueil provisoire des migrants irréguliers sont améliorés en vue de les rendre conformes aux standards de dignité et en matière de droits humains.

R.2.2 Les capacités opérationnelles en matière de gestion de l’immigration irrégulière et le traitement des personnes migrantes sont renforcées, en lien avec les partenaires dédiés.

R.2.3 Le système de gestion de l’immigration irrégulière dans ses différentes étapes est amélioré.
partner_implementing: Fundación Internacional y para Iberoamérica de Administración y Políticas Públicas
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Communication and Visibility - EUTF Programmes in Ethiopia
summary:
The project aims at developing visibility and promotional products and actions in order to increase visibility of the EUTF programmes and to deliver key messages related to the EUTF portfolio in Ethiopia to the general public, decision makers and other relevant stakeholders both in Ethiopia and in Europe. 

The geographical area covered by the contract are all the regions targeted by the EUTF interventions (Addis Ababa,Tigray, Afar, Somali and Gambella regional states, among others).

The target groups are ample and varied, although it is expected to reach mainly the general public and more specifically, policy makers, government officials, development partners, and all relevant stakeholders working on or interested in irregular migration and forced displacement , job creation, private sector development, access to basic services (education, health, water among others, social cohesion and peace building.

title: Protecting most vulnerable populations from the COVID 19 pandemic in Libya
summary:
UNICEF’s overall COVID-19 response directly contributes to and builds on the nine-pillar National Preparedness and Response Plan, supported by UN agencies, including UNICEF. It specifically contributes to three pillars of the nine-pillar plan: Coordination (Pillar 1), risk communication and community engagement (Pillar 2), Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) - Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) (Pillar 6), and the continuity of essential healthcare and protection services (Pillar 9). The Action also includes a child protection component, preventing and addressing heightened protection risks related to the pandemic. The action is in line with the global and regional COVID-19 Humanitarian Action for Children (HAC) appeal, as well as UNICEF Libya’s Humanitarian Action for Children 2020.  

The proposed action’s overall objective is **to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and to reduce avoidable morbidity and mortality in Libya.** The action will **contribute to reducing human-to-human transmission of the virus and to mitigate the impact of the pandemic on most vulnerable populations in Libya, including children, youth, migrants, and displaced persons.**

title: Managing mixed migration flows: protection, health assistance, resilience and community engagement
summary: The focus of this project is to strengthen the protection and resilience of vulnerable migrants and migrants at risk, with emphasis on registered asylum-seekers and refugees living in urban settings in Libya. Nevertheless, as well as to provide assistance to refugees, asylum-seekers and migrants inside detention centres and as well as to persons rescued/intercepted at sea upon disembarkation and to improve access to protection and solutions of stranded and vulnerable PoCs to UNHCR through emergency evacuations out of Libya.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Provision of international air services for humanitarian and development actors in Eritrea
summary: This action will support the continuation of WFP Global Passenger Air Service flights connecting Addis Ababa and Asmara allowing the international development and humanitarian actors to continue their operation in Eritrea. WFP supports the development partners’ response by transporting international personnel and cargo to Asmara from Addis Ababa through the WFPs Global Passenger Air Service. The latter will guarantee the running of International Flights as commercial international and domestic flights in Eritrea are suspended until further notice because the COVID-19 pandemic situation.

title: Provision of international air services for humanitarian and development actors in Eritrea
summary:
This action will support the continuation of WFP Global Passenger Air Service flights connecting Addis Ababa and Asmara allowing the international development and humanitarian actors to continue their operation in Eritrea.

WFP supports the development partners’ response by transporting international personnel and cargo to Asmara from Addis Ababa through the WFPs Global Passenger Air Service. The latter will guarantee the running of International Flights as commercial international and domestic flights in Eritrea are suspended until further notice due to the COVID-19 pandemic situation.

title: Education in Emergency Programme in Four Former States in South Sudan - WFP
summary: 75,000 children at the primary school level benefit from school feeding and nutrition messaging.

title: Regional Approaches for Sustainable Conflict Management and Integration
summary:
Specific Objective: To prevent local conflict and mitigate its impact. Expected Result: The promotion of peacebuilding, conflict management, and  conflict resolution capacity at the community and cross-border levels. 

###### Specific Objective(s)

1. Increasing Social Capital and Cohesion  

2. Strengthening Peace Structures to Build Long-Term Resilience to Conflict

title: Building Opportunities for Resilience in the Horn of Africa -BORESHA II
summary:
The project 'Building Opportunities for Resilience in the Horn of Africa- BORESHA' is a continuation of a previous project following the same overall objective to promote economic development and greater resilience, particularly among vulnerable groups, with the implementing area covering three countries in the Mandera triangle, Kenya, Ethiopia and Somalia.

The specific objectives/outcomes are:

1. Communities in the Mandera Triangle are more resilient and better prepared for shocks, and response is more effective.
2. Selected individuals and communities are more self-reliant through increased skills and opportunities for cross-border employment, diversified enterprise and livelihoods.
3. Cross-border rangeland and other shared natural resources are more equitably and sustainably managed.

​
partner_extending: World Vision, CARE

title: Appui à la protection des migrants les plus vulnérables en Afrique de l'Ouest

title: Protecting most vulnerable populations from the COVID 19 pandemic in Libya
summary:
The overall goal is to prevent the spread of C-19 and reduce avoidable morbidity and mortality in Libya.

The specific objective of this action is to improve the capacities of the Libyan authorities to address C- 19 related challenges as well as assist the vulnerable population of Libya, including migrants, IDPs and conflict-affected communities with protection and life-saving support.

title: Managing mixed migration flows: protection, health assistance, resilience and community engagement

title: Municipal development in the context of mixed migration
summary:
The Common Action falls under the North of Africa Window of the European Union Emergency Trust Fund for Stability and addressing root-causes of irregular migration and displaced persons in Africa (EUTF – NoA). It builds on the approach and the objectives set under the 'Local Governance and socio-economic development Pillar' of the program "Managing mixed migration flows in Libya" (T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-03) and expands geographically and financially the EU support to this pillar. 

The **Overall Objective** of the Common Action (in line with Priority Action IV) is to contribute _“__**to foster a more inclusive social and economic environment and stability in the region**__” (_Strategic Objective 4. of the EUTF – NOA**).**This Common Action is an extension and further upscaling of the Action “Support to municipalities in Libya”, currently implemented by the GIZ. It aims at enabling municipalities and other key actors to improve the level and quality of services at the local level. It also aims at fostering local economic recovery and inclusion of migrants, IDPs, and other vulnerable groups throughout the recovery process.

iati_id: Social Transfers for vulnerable Somali people
title: SAGAL
summary:
The action will improve resilience of households to conflict and climate related shocks and disasters targeting 44,221 households, or 265,326 individuals with a focus on internally displaced persons (IDPs), returnees and host communities. The action will provide cash based social transfers complemented by systems building with government for delivery of social protection. Cash based social transfers will support households to improve nutrition and food and livelihoods security as well as combining interventions with actions to positively transform gender norms and reduce gender barriers, particularly for women. In line with the UN Convention of Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD) the action will ensure mainstreaming by including people with special needs such as people living with disabilities.  

The action will be implemented by the Somali Cash Consortium (consortium), with Concern Worldwide (Concern) as lead agency and its members Save the Children International (SCI), Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) and Danish Refugee Council (DRC). The approach will have two components: 1) through the provision of cash based social transfer to support targeted households to reduce vulnerability and poverty to reduce the impact of shocks and disasters linking humanitarian and development approaches; and 2) through the provision of support to build systems at the federal, regional and district levels required for a government-led social protection system.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Protection, Health and Livelihood for Refugees in Burundi
summary:
The project seeks to support both communities, refugees and the host community, on one hand to meet their specific immediate needs and on the other, to make refugees better equipped to participate in social cohesion activities and benefit from development interventions in refugee hosting areas. The proposed project is designed in a way to create conditions that will allow refugee and hosts to live together harmoniously, while supporting refugees to engage in local development and self-reliance activities.

The project objective will be achieved through 3 interrelated components: strengthening protection and monitoring; access to health services; and livelihood support activities. The project will be implemented by UNHCR and its partners including IRC, Terre des Hommes, AVSI, GVC and JRS over 24 months.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Common Operational Partnership (COP) Mali
summary:
The overall objective (expected impact) of this action is to contribute to the fight against criminal networks involved in irregular migration, migrant smuggling and trafficking in human beings in Mali. 

The specific objectives (expected outcomes) are the following:  

1. Strengthening the capacities, at operational and judicial levels, of the Malian police unit in charge of pursuing and prosecuting criminal networks (notably in the areas of irregular migration, migrant smuggling and trafficking in human beings), and in so doing improving border management. 

2. Increasing the volume of cases on criminal networks involved in migrant smuggling and trafficking in human beings (with specific attention to women victims of trafficking) investigated by the police and improving the corresponding resolution rate, including through regional cooperation with similar police units in the region.
partner_implementing: Civipol, Fundación Internacional y para Iberoamérica de Administración y Políticas Públicas
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Protection, Health and Livelihood for Refugees in Burundi
summary:
The project seeks to support both communities, refugees and the host community, on one hand to meet their specific immediate needs and on the other, to make refugees better equipped to participate in social cohesion activities and benefit from development interventions in refugee hosting areas. The proposed project is designed in a way to create conditions that will allow refugee and hosts to live together harmoniously, while supporting refugees to engage in local development and self-reliance activities.

The project objective will be achieved through 3 interrelated components: strengthening protection and monitoring; access to health services; and livelihood support activities. The project will be implemented by IRC and its implementing partners Terre des Hommes, AVSI, GVC , JRS and UNHCR over 24 months.

title: Dukorane Umurava - Upscaling Economic Inclusion of Refugees and Host Communities to Gicumbi District
summary:
The overall objective of the Action is to increase the well-being of displaced populations and their host communities and reduce inequalities between these groups. The specific objective of the Action is to reduce the negative socio-economic impact of new and recurrent displacement situations. The regional focus is on Gihembe refugee camp in Rwanda’s Northern Province and the host district Gicumbi, where youth will be supported in accessing wage-employment or self-employment. 

The specific objective is to be reached by applying an integrated approach to employment promotion, combining four interlinked fields of activity: (1) enhancing framework conditions at national and local level for refugees and host communities to become (self-)employed, (2) business start-ups and entrepreneurship promotion, (3) technical and vocational training for young refugees and young women and men from the neighbouring communities, and (4) psychosocial support and conflict transformation. 

This builds on the approach and experiences of the bilateral project “Economic Inclusion of Refugees and Host Communities” (SI Refugee), commissioned by the Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) under the Special Initiative Forced Displacement, which is being implemented by the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH in three refugee camps Mugombwa, Kigeme, Mahama and their neighbouring districts from September 2018 up to 31 August 2023.

title: Sécurité et bien-être accrus des réfugiés du camp de Mahama et de leur communauté d'accueil, complémentarité socio-économique renforcée entre ces groupes
summary:
**Objectifs de l’action:**

Assurer la sécurité financière et le bien-être des réfugiés du camp de Mahama et de leur communauté d’accueil et promouvoir la complémentarité socio-économique entre ces groupes.

**Objectifs spécifiques:**

· Accès accru aux opportunités d'emploi régulier;

· Accroissement des initiatives communes de développement entre les réfugiés et la communauté hôte;

· Réduction de la dépendance des réfugiés du Camp de Mahama aux programmes d’aide et augmentation de l’autosuffisance des membres de la communauté hôte.

**Produits escomptés**

· Des jeunes réfugiés et ceux de la communauté d’accueil formés en différents métiers

· Des jeunes lauréats des formations accèdent à des emplois rémunérés dans des entreprises privées

· Des jeunes et adultes réfugiés et membres de la communauté hôte acquièrent des compétences suffisantes dans la mise en place et gestions de microprojets viables

· Des microprojets viables développés par les réfugiés et membres de la communauté hôte

· De nouveaux emplois créés au sein des micro-projets mise en place conjointement par les réfugiés et les membres de la communauté hôte

· Des ménages de réfugiés et de la communauté d’accueil augmentent leurs revenus annuels d’au moins 30% et subviennent à leurs besoins de base par leurs propres moyens

**Principales activités**

· Former les jeunes en différents métiers selon les besoins du marché ;

· Placer les jeunes lauréats des formations dans des entreprises pour des stages professionnels/emplois ;

· Former les réfugiés et les membres de la communauté hôtes sur la création et gestion de microprojets viables (entreprenariat) en groupes de solidarité;

· Octroyer des subventions d’équipement aux groupes solidaires promoteurs de microprojets viables

· Encadrer les jeunes entrepreneurs et les éduquer sur l’épargne-crédit

· Faire le suivi-évaluation des activités, au début, à mi-parcours et à la fin du projet

​

title: Protection des personnes migrantes en situation de vulnérabilité en Tunisie

title: Radio Jeunesse Sahel  - Appui européen à la phase de démarrage de la radio
summary:
L’objectif principal de la radio est de favoriser le vivre ensemble avec une vision constructive et inclusive de l’avenir en offrant aux jeunes dans leur diversité à la fois un sens d’appropriation de leur avenir, le reflet de leur réalité́ et un contenu authentique, crédible, fiable et inspirant.

title: Enhancing self-reliance and access to rights for refugees and asylum-seekers in North Africa
summary: The purpose of this project is to provide refugees and asylum-seekers in Egypt with access to education, health and services that address particular vulnerabilities such as sexual and gender-based violence.

title: Programme de soutien à l’économie dans le contexte de la crise du COVID 19 en Côte d’Ivoire (PSRE-COVID-CI)
summary:
L’objectif général du programme est de créer les conditions d’une reprise durable de l’économie ivoirienne pour palier le ralentissement économique observé suite à la crise COVID-19. L’objectif spécifique est de donner aux entreprises et aux acteurs productifs de l’économie nationale les moyens de résister à la crise du COVID-19.

Les résultats visés sont:

R.1.1 : Le Fonds d’appui aux grandes entreprises est utilisé à hauteur de 14 millions d’Euros pour couvrir/donner des garanties.

R.1.2 : Le Fonds d’appui aux PME est utilisé à hauteur de 10 millions d’euros sous forme de garantie ou de prêts pour des entreprises qui répondent aux critères d’éligibilité.

R.2 : Le comité de gestion bénéficie de l’expertise technique indépendante du secrétariat exécutif dans l’analyse des dossiers des candidats.
partner_implementing: Fundación Internacional y para Iberoamérica de Administración y Políticas Públicas
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Appui à la mise en œuvre de la Stratégie nationale de l’état civil et de l’identification de Côte d’Ivoire
summary:
Ce projet constitue une continuation des efforts de l’Union européenne en appui à la modernisation du système d’état civil en Côte d’Ivoire et mettra les bases d’un important futur appui. L'objectif global de cette intervention est d’appuyer la mise en œuvre de la Stratégie nationale de l’état civil et de l’identification en Côte d’Ivoire.  

L’action permettra plus spécifiquement, de renforcer les capacités techniques des acteurs clefs pour la réforme de l’état civil, leur dynamique de coordination, mener un plaidoyer en faveur d’une mobilisation par l’Etat des ressources propres nécessaires à l’opérationnalisation de la réforme. En étroite collaboration avec la DUE, l’agence chargée de la mise en œuvre de l’action sera un partenaire incontournable des autorités ivoiriennes chargées de l’opérationnalisation de la réforme de l’état civil (ONECI).  

La qualité des résultats obtenus grâce à ce projet dans le dialogue avec les acteurs de l’état civil et notamment avec l’ONECI seront déterminants pour la suite des actions de l’UE dans le secteur.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Appui à la justice au Burkina Faso pour renforcer la lutte contre l’impunité au travers d’un système judiciaire plus accessible et efficace
summary:
Cette action vise à lutter contre l’impunité en renforçant le secteur de la justice, et a un budget de 10 millions d’euros pour une durée de mise en œuvre de 36 mois. 

L’objectif général sera de contribuer à améliorer au niveau national le fonctionnement de la justice pour lutter contre le sentiment général d’impunité au Burkina Faso, ce qui se déclinera en deux grands objectifs stratégiques : 1) l’amélioration générale du fonctionnement de la chaine pénale, afin de répondre à la demande de justice dans l'ensemble du pays ; et 2) le renforcement du système judiciaire au travers de la mise en œuvre et la concrétisation de certains chantiers prioritaires. Il y aura d’un côté, en première priorité de ce projet, un objectif stratégique poursuivant l'obtention de résultats tangibles à court terme, répondant à des besoins conjoncturels – à savoir la résorption des retards accumulés dans la chaîne pénale, visant la résolution des nombreux cas en attente de traitement - alors que le deuxième objectif stratégique poursuit une volonté de travailler sur des questions structurelles, afin d'augmenter l'efficience du système judiciaire et d'en pérenniser des résultats.  Dans ce même objectif, une priorité forte est mise également sur l'amélioration de la justice militaire et de sa propre chaine de commandement. Enfin, afin de contribuer à l'amélioration de la perception de la justice par la population, ainsi que potentiellement au désengorgement des tribunaux, les possibilités de la justice de proximité seront explorées à travers des opérations pilotes.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Soutien à la création d’un escadron polyvalent de la Garde Nationale du Niger (EP-GNN)
summary:
L’objectif global (impact attendu) de l'action est de contribuer à la sécurité des populations et à la stabilisation du Niger, y inclus dans les zones éloignées et transfrontalières, notamment dans la région de Tahoua, comme condition préalable pour leur développement socioéconomique durable. 

 

L’objectif spécifique est de renforcer la capacité d'action préventive et réactive de la Garde Nationale du Niger (GNN) afin de garantir un contrôle plus efficace du territoire, y inclus dans les zones éloignées et transfrontalières. 

 Les résultats attendus de l’Action sont :  

- Résultat 1: Un nouvel escadron polyvalent de la GNN à 200 personnels est créé et dispose des équipements nécessaires pour pouvoir intervenir de façon autonome et sécurisée dans des zones hostiles et reculées du Niger. 

- Résultat 2 : Un escadron polyvalent de la GNN conduit ses missions dans un cadre de gouvernance respectueux des règles d’éthique, de déontologie et de respect des droits humains.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Retour de la confiance et renforcement des capacités sécuritaires au Burkina Faso (RENFORCES BURKINA FASO III)
summary: L'objectif global du projet est de contribuer à la stabilisation et à la sécurité des populations dans la région du Sahel du Burkina Faso en permettant aux Forces de Sécurité Intérieure (FSI) d’assurer leur mission de sécurisation du territoire, dans le respect de l’Etat de droit, et aux services publics et autorités locales de répondre aux besoins des populations locales. Les objectifs spécifiques sont 1) d’améliorer les conditions de déploiement et de mobilité des détachements des forces de sécurité intérieure burkinabè via le renforcement des protections de 2 à 3 emprises et 2) de renforcer les liens de confiance entre citoyens, administrations et forces de sécurité intérieure et contribuer au retour des services publics.

title: Résilience agro-sylvo-pastorale, Ouest Niger
summary:
L’objectif global (impact attendu) de l’action est de « Contribuer au renforcement de la résilience des communautés pastorales et agropastorales ainsi que des écosystèmes de l’Ouest du Niger ». 

L’objectif spécifique (résultats attendus) est le suivant : « La sécurisation et la gestion des ressources naturelles/biodiversité de l’Ouest du Niger sont améliorés pour contribuer au développement de la zone et à la cohabitation pacifique ».
partner_implementing: Wild African Conservation, ENABEL - Belgian Development Agency
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Amélioration de l’accès aux services de base et aux droits pour les réfugiés et demandeurs d’asile en Tunisie
partner_funding: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, EU Trust Fund for Africa
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Enhancing access to rights for refugees and asylum-seekers in North Africa
summary:
This proposal complements the activities covered under the Protection Pillar of the Regional Development and Protection Programme (RDPP) for North Africa, phase four, covering 24 months between 01/01/2020 and 31/12/2021.

The RDPP phase four is composed of two activities, namely (i) improving protection in Northern and Eastern regions by referring potential asylum seekers from these regions to UNHCR in Rabat, followed by (ii) registering subsequent asylum claims leading to a joint refugee status determination (RSD) with the Moroccan authorities.

Activities foreseen within the RDPP phase four framework aim to safeguard rights of asylum seekers in Morocco. These activities are a first stage in the asylum process so that asylum seekers eligible for international protection can be recognised as refugees. Once recognised, UNHCR can accompany refugees in their integration in Morocco and can provide humanitarian assistance to those in need. In this light, RDPP phase four activities, targeting asylum-seekers, complement other activities foreseen within the following project funded by the EU Trust Fund for Africa, targeting refugees.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Projet pilote d’amélioration du système d’état civil guinéen par l’effet catalyseur de la digitalisation
summary:
Ce projet se donne comme objectif spécifique de « Renforcer le cadre institutionnel et opérationnel du système d’état civil guinéen pour prendre en compte les modifications liées à la digitalisation». L’idée est de développer les « fondamentaux » d’une digitalisation de l’état civil sécurisée, adaptée, et durable au contexte guinéen alors que cet Etat entreprend dans d’autres domaines des démarches de transition digitale. Intervenant auprès de différents niveaux d’acteurs de l’état civil (en charge du pilotage de la réforme, des agents de coordination et de contrôles, les services producteurs, promoteurs ou utilisateurs) autour de l’axe Conakry-Kindia-Mamou, le projet ambitionne d’atteindre les résultats suivants :

R1 : Le cadre légal et opérationnel de l’état civil guinéen est renforcé pour permettre une digitalisation sécurisée et sécurisante pour les populations.

R2 : Un projet pilote de digitalisation est identifié, accepté, séquencé et testé pour une solution durable, sécurisée et adaptée au contexte.

R3 : Les acteurs de l’état civil dans les zones ciblées sont renforcés dans leur pratique.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: RESIGUI / Améliorer la résilience des populations vulnérables de Guinée
summary:
En réponse à l’épidémie, le projet RESIGUI mettra en place immédiatement après l’urgence et le redressement, une intervention intégrée de résilience et de filets sociaux. En coordination avec la réponse des acteurs présents dans les zones ciblées, l’intervention du PAM vise à stabiliser sans délai le statut alimentaire et nutritionnel de 20 000 ménages vulnérables à l’insécurité alimentaire pendant la période de soudure et post-soudure aggravée par le choc COVID-19, et ce, avant de les accompagner progressivement vers le plus long terme pour améliorer leurs moyens de subsistance.

​
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Digitalising The Gambia – Technical assistance to strengthen the ICT sector
summary:
This 24-month technical assistance project will provide Gamtel and Gambian regulatory authorities the necessary capacity to implement the regulation and policies of the sector with the delivery of 1/ a business plan, 2/ financial proposals and 3/ robust tendering methods. Eventually Gamtel will acquire broadband technology solutions that will be rolled-out in the Greater Banjul Area (during a pilot phase) and potentially all over the country.

At the end of the project the staff of Gamtel with the support of Gambian regulatory authorities will have the necessary management and business development skills to scale up its technical solutions for Banjul region towards the rest of Gambia including the rural areas, leading to 8,000 more people in the Greater Banjul Area being connected to a quality internet service, with a potential to expand to the whole country.

Those objectives match the Gambian government priorities of the National Development Plan (NDP) 2018 – 2021, whose fifth objective is to “Make The Gambia a Digital Nation and create a modern information society” by harnessing the benefits of ICT in all sectors of the economy for inclusive & sustainable development,

Those objectives are in line with the EUTF efforts on youth empowerment, job creation and support to local business environment with a more connected rural areas and supporting the government in providing enhanced and more inclusive services to their citizens, with a significant contribution to an “Improved Governance” in The Gambia.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Strengthening protection and resilience of vulnerable groups in COVID-19 emergency
summary:
The Overall Objective of the intervention is to support improved protection and resilience of refugees, migrants, asylum seekers, IDPs, and host communities in Libya. This action builds on the previous programming under EUTF-funded action “StrengtheningProtection and Resilience of Displaced Populations in Libya - Increasing access to PrimaryHealth Care for Mixed Migrants and Displaced Libyans” (No. T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-01-01 T05.62), as well as other activities that IMC is currently implementing to respond to the ongoing global emergency caused by COVID-19.

The Specific Objective of the intervention are to support health system in Tripoli to provide quality COVID-19 related services to mixed migrants and local populations.

Accomplishment of this objective will be achieved through the three results below.

Result 1: 2 Primary healthcare centres (as selected by the MoH) are prepared and equipped to respond to COVID-19.

Result 2: A hospital in Tripoli (as selected by the MoH) is supported to improve COVID-19 management capacity and response.

Result 3: Health education, risk communication and community engagement for COVID-19 prevention and response are improved.

​

title: Promotion de l'emploi pour le renforcement de la résilience économique des communautés dans la région de Tillabéry
summary:
L’objectif global (impact attendu) de l’action est de soutenir la création d’emploi et renforcer la résilience économique des communautés locales, en particulier des jeunes, dans la région de Tillabéry. 

Les objectifs spécifiques (résultats attendus) sont les suivants: 

Objectif spécifique 1 : La situation de l’emploi des jeunes femmes et hommes s’est améliorée.

Objectif spécifique 2 : La capacité de l’économie locale à générer des emplois et des revenus est durablement renforcée.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: CRIALCES - Réponse à la CRIse ALimentaire au CEntre Sahel : support nutritionnel et relèvement
summary: Suivant les estimations du Cadre Harmonisé et l’analyse ‘Hotspot’ produite par le PAM et UNICEF, 4,8 millions de personnes seront en insécurité alimentaire pendant la période de soudure (Juin-Septembre 2020) pour l’ensemble du Centre Sahel, dont 1,6 million de personnes, soit un tiers, dans le Liptako Gourma. La situation nutritionnelle est également très alarmante avec une augmentation attendue des cas de malnutrition aigüe à la suite de la crise COVID, mais également en raison de la détérioration importante de la sécurité alimentaire et sécuritaire (Annexe 3). Pour 2020, les cas de malnutrition aigüe attendus dans les 3 pays de Centre Sahel s’élèvent à 2,8 millions avec près de 40% des cas dans le Liptako Gourma, qui comptera plus de 1,1 million de cas en 2020 (dont 290 250 au Burkina Faso, 321 860 au Mali et 514 120 au Niger).
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, World Food Programme
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Regional - Pour une approche holistique de la gouvernance de la migration de main d’œuvre et la mobilité en Afrique du Nord – THAMM Phase II
summary:
L'action Pour une approche holistique de la gouvernance de la migration de main d’oeuvre et la mobilité en Afrique du Nord – THAMM Phase II vise à promouvoir et organiser la mobilité professionnelle entre la Tunisie et la France et des États européens potentiellement intéressés.

En continuité avec THAMM Phase I, l’Action adopte une approche holistique de la gouvernance de la migration de main-d'oeuvre et de la mobilité de la main-d'oeuvre en Afrique du Nord, cette approche est triplement gagnant pour le pays d’origine (la Tunisie), le pays de destination (la France) et les travailleurs.

En effet, le partenariat avec les pays partenaires visant à assurer le « matching » des compétences et des besoins de main d’oeuvre dans les secteurs sous tension en Europe, est mutuellement bénéfique pour le pays de destination et le pays d'origine.

Au même temps, la mobilité circulaire offre la possibilité au travailleur d’acquérir en Europe des compétences qui accroissent son employabilité lors de son retour au Pays d’origine. La promotion de la mobilité circulaire envoie un signal positif aux Tunisien(ne)s incité(e)s à se mettre en projet de manière constructive pour acquérir des compétences exportables plutôt qu’envisager des voies migratoires plus précaires.

L’Action sera mise en oeuvre par l’office Français d’Immigration et Intégration (OFII). Elle
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Libya - Recovery, stability and socio-economic development in Libya – Phase 2 (RSSD 2)
summary:
The Action falls under the North of Africa Window of the European Union Emergency Trust Fund for stability and addressing root causes of irregular migration and displaced persons in Africa (EUTF – NOA). It builds on the ongoing programme “Recovery, Stability and Socio-Economic Development in Libya” (RSSD) phase 1 (T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-05).

In order to generate more complete and coherent stabilization impacts, the proposed RSSD 2 programme will go beyond the prevailing service delivery scope of RSSD 1. The emphasis will lie on economic development at the local level (decent job creation, sustainability) while fostering social cohesion and community security.
partner_implementing: UNICEF, United Nations Development Programme, Agenzia italiana per la cooperazione allo sviluppo
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Libya - Protecting most vulnerable populations from the COVID 19 pandemic in Libya
summary:
The overall objective of the action is to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and to reduce avoidable morbidity and mortality in Libya. This corresponds to EUTF North of Africa Window (EUTF-NOA) Strategic Objective 3: to strengthen protection and resilience of those in need.

The specific objective is to provide specialised support to the Libyan authorities to address COVID-19 related challenges as well as assist the most vulnerable population in Libya, in particular (but not exclusively), migrants and forcibly displaced persons.
partner_funding: UNICEF, World Health Organization, EU Trust Fund for Africa
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Regional - Fast track emergency response to COVID-19 in NoA countries for the most vulnerable populations COVID-19
summary:
The overall objective of the action is to contribute to reducing acute vulnerabilities and improve resilience in light of the COVID-19 pandemic in NoA countries.

The specific objective is to respond to emergency needs related to the effects of the COVID-19 crisis on NoA countries, focusing on migrants and forcibly displaced persons (including returnees, stateless people, asylum seekers, refugees and internally displaced persons), hereafter “migrants and forcibly displaced persons”, especially the most vulnerable and at risk among them, as well as their host communities.

Among NoA countries, and considering the limited amount of funds of this AD, the actions will be primarily focused on Algeria and Egypt. Tunisia will be considered too as well as Morocco, depending on needs, gaps and funds available. Libya is of equal concern, but at the moment of writing this AD a solution for a specific COVID-19 response Action in Libya is sought.

The Action contributes to Objective (3) "Improved migration management in countries of origin, transit and destination" of the EU Trust Fund for Africa and in particular to the Priority Action III - Strengthening protection and resilience of migrants and forcibly displaced and their host communities. The action is also aligned with the Valletta Action Plan Priority Domain 3 “Protection and asylum” and with the Joint Communication to the European Parliament, the Council, the European Economic and Social Committee and the Committee of the Regions, Brussels 8 April 2020 and the Team Europe approach, mainly with its first component: urgent, short-term emergency response to the health crisis and the resulting humanitarian need. The other two components could be addressed (health systems strengthening and socio economic impact) if additional funds are available and according to needs in the target countries.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Regional - Continuation - Technical Cooperation Facility (TCF): Formulation of programmes, Implementation of the Monitoring and Evaluation Framework and Research activities
summary:
The action aims to increase the effectiveness of the EUTF Africa North of Africa Window (EUTF-NOA) programmes in addressing the root causes of migration and forced displacement in West and North Africa. This will be achieved by ensuring that the EUTF-NOA decision-making is evidence based at all levels (from identification to formulation and implementation) through strong monitoring and research frameworks. By increasing the effectiveness of programmes funded under the EUTF-NOA, the Action will indirectly contribute to improve the migrant conditions in the North of Africa Countries.

The Action covers horizontally the five priority areas of intervention of the Valetta Action plan, notably a) Migration Governance b) Promote mutually-beneficial legal migration and mobility c) Ensuring protection for those in need, d) Tackle irregular migration, and support sustainable return and reintegration policies and e) Improve information and the protection of vulnerable migrants along the migratory route.

The Action has a regional coverage, comprising all five eligible countries under the EUTF-NOA.

The intervention logic is to provide specialised expertise. In particular, the security situation in Libya is extremely volatile and unpredictable, EU actors have only a restricted access. Hence special service contracts need to be put in place with experts having the capacity of access to provide the EUTF-NOA with eyes on the ground.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Regional – Durable solutions for refugee unaccompanied and separated children (Libya and Egypt) and family reunification
summary: The overall objective is to improve the protection and expand access to sustainable solutions for unaccompanied and separated children (UASC)6 and youth along the Central Mediterranean
partner_funding: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, EU Trust Fund for Africa
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Libya - Continuation - Managing mixed migration flows: Protection, health assistance, resilience and community engagement
summary:
The overall objective of the action is to save lives and improve the resilience of vulnerable migrants, migrants at risk, asylum seekers, refugees and host communities (including IDPs and returnees) in Libya and to increase social cohesion among these groups. The specific objective is to provide high quality lifesaving multi sectoral and dignified protection interventions and services to these vulnerable groups.

These objectives are now even more relevant than before in light of the COVID-19 pandemic and its effects for vulnerable populations and populations at risk both in terms of life saving interventions, relief assistance, health assistance and increasing risks in social cohesion, livelihoods and stigmatisation.
partner_funding: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, EU Trust Fund for Africa
partner_implementing: World Health Organization, International Organization for Migration
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Enhancing self-reliance for refugees and host communities
summary: The general objective of the project is to ensure better management and protection of refugees and enhance and  support  government capacity to roll-out CRRF approaches that will contribute to transforming the humanitarian model of assistance for refugees towards development-oriented solutions that enhance the self-reliance of refugees and host communities.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Area-based livlehood initiative Garissa (ABLI-G): enhancing self-reliance for refugees and host communities in Garissa County
summary:
The  overall  objective  of  the  project  is  to  enhance  the  self-reliance  of  refugees  and  host  communities in Kenya. 

The specific objectives of the project are:

 1. Refugee  and  local individuals  have  improved  and  diversified  skills  and  competencies  that support  opportunities  for  income  generation and  saving,  resulting  in  increased  absorptive  resilience.  

2. Entrepreneurs and enterprises have improved economic opportunities through promotion of entrepreneurship and business development capacity resulting in strengthened adaptive resilience. 

3. Improved  business  environment that enables economic  opportunities for refugee and local communities,   resulting   in   enhancing   the   transformative   resilience   capacity   of   market   systems.
partner_extending: Norwegian Refugee Council
partner_implementing: ITC - International Trade Center, Danish Refugee Council

title: KEOOGO en appui DGLPAP - Contribuer à la détection, à la surveillance et à la prévention de la radicalisation et de l’extrémisme violent au Burkina Faso.
summary: Objectif général : Contribuer à la détection, à la surveillance et à la prévention de la radicalisation et de l’extrémisme violent au Burkina Faso.

title: Support to the Centre of Government
summary: The European Union Delegation to Sudan is supporting the transitional government through a project of EUR 6.9M, which is managed by a service provider and closely coordinated with the Prime Minister’s Office. The objective of the project is to support governmental institutions with crucial resources such as policy advice and equipment in order to achieve the top priorities of peace, economic recovery, transition to civilian democracy and inclusive, accountable and responsive governance systems set by the government.

title: TDH Lausanne Projet d'accompagnement des consortia dans le cadre de la mise en oeuvre du programme FFU-PEV
SEM FILMS Des ambassadeurs de la jeunesse
summary: quatre objectifs spécifiques liés à quatre axes d’intervention :  -	ECOUTER : Favoriser l’écoute et la libre expression des communautés, particulièrement des jeunes dans la région -	PARLER : Sensibiliser la population à la cohésion sociale par la diffusion de messages de tolérance et de vivre ensemble -	DIALOGUER : Créer des cadres permanents d’échange entre les couches de la population et les pouvoirs publics -	TRANSMETTRE : Renforcer les capacités des jeunes pour pérenniser les actions entreprises et capables à transmettre et capitaliser pour d’autres jeunes
partner_accountable: EU Delegation Burkina Faso, EU Delegation Burkina Faso

title: Cross-border collaboration programme in Western Ethiopia and Eastern Sudan
summary: The overall objective of the proposed action is to strengthen the populations’ resilience to instability and displacement in the cross-border areas of Benishangul Gumuz/Ethiopia and Blue Nile State/Sudan. This will include investments in enhancing and diversifying livelihoods, including livestock, agriculture and fisheries; strengthening basic service delivery; natural resource management; and promoting cross-border cooperation and coordination, trade and private sector development as well supporting conflict management and resolution capacities.
partner_funding: Bundesministerium fur wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung, EU Trust Fund for Africa

title: Job Creation and Trade Development for South Sudan
summary:
This action takes a further step in EU support to the South Sudan rural development, building on grounds laid through SORUDEV, ZEAT-BEAD and EUTF relevant programmes. The focus here is on promoting economically viable activities that will allow people to capitalise the peace dividends.

South Sudan does not have access to programmable bilateral resources from the 11th European Development Fund (EDF) as it is not amongst the signatories of the Cotonou Agreement, and hence there is reliance on other sources of funding, such as the EUTF Africa. The EUTF funds allocated to South Sudan aligns with the EUTF strategic objectives, and this action addresses one of the key priorities set for the EUTF Horn of Africa window by the EUTF Strategic Board in April 2018: essential stabilisation in South Sudan, the lack of which is a root cause for displacement and irregular migration.

The project is in line with the priorities of the Government as elaborated in the South Sudan National Development Strategy 2018-2021, its Development Plan of 2011, as well as the Comprehensive Agriculture Master Plan (CAMP) 2016. It contributes to the implementation of priority actions and recommendations contained in these development plans and strategies.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Education Quality Improvement Programme 2 (EQUIP 2)
summary:
The action will enhance the ability of children and other groups living in vulnerable situations to lead socially and economically productive lives. In doing so their resilience will be strengthened, as well as that of their communities. Hence, the action will contribute to creating better living conditions, enhancing social cohesion, and reducing the risk of these populations to fall into negative coping mechanisms.

In alignment with Sudan’s Education Sector Strategic Plan (2017-2023), the Education Improvement Programme 2 (EQUIP 2) will contribute to fulfill the right to education, ensure the improvement of learning outcomes and the increased completion rates in quality primary education of children in Sudan, with particular attention to groups living in vulnerable situations, including migrants, IDPs and refugees, especially girls, through the improvement of equitable access to quality primary education.

 In November 2021, the Fund adopted a €4,9 million top-up to the action to ensure that Sudanese children continue to have access to quality education. As there cannot be any learning without well-trained and motivated teachers, the additional funds will allow the extension of the component on teachers training to the entire country. 10 000 students teachers, 400 faculty of education trainers, 108 supervisors and 54 headmasters’ trainers will now benefit from EQUIP2 activities. The increased funding shows the commitment of the EU to Sudan: while the EU strongly condemns the recent military coup, it is determined to continue its support for projects like this one that are solely for the benefit of the Sudanese people.  The EU stands ready to protect Sudanese children’s right to education.
partner_implementing: SOFRECO, Agence Française d'Expertise Technique Internationale, Save the Children
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Support to sustainable peace, rule of law and human rights during Sudan’s democratic transition towards transparent, inclusive and credible elections
summary: The overall objective of this multi-component programme is to support sustainable peace, rule of law and human rights during Sudan’s democratic transition towards transparent, inclusive and credible elections. The specific objectives are; i) To promote and protect human rights in Sudan, in particular to address existing and potential drivers of conflict; ii) To support the electoral process in Sudan.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada , Department for International Development UK, U.S. Agency for International Development, SIDA, Germany
partner_implementing: The UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Support to Economic Opportunities for Youth and Women
summary:
This multi-component programme aims to enhance economic opportunities for youth and women. The specific objectives are: i) strengthening the gum Arabic value chain in Blue Nile, Sennar, Gedaref and North Kordofan States; ii) creating a conducive environment for the economic empowerment of the most vulnerable women living in the most vulnerable situations in Khartoum, Kassala, Gedaref and Red Sea States; iii) improve employment conditions for the youth (with an emphasis on women and refugees) in Khartoum State.

In December 2021, this action received a €10 million top-up to contribute to its first specific objective aiming at strengthening the gum Arabic value chain in Blue Nile, Sennar, Gedaref and North Kordofan States.
partner_implementing: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women, Government Of Sudan
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Support to the Economic transition
summary:
The overall objective of this multi-component programme is to support the Government of Sudan (GoS) in its efforts to achieve sound and inclusive economic reforms during the democratic transition. Its specific objectives are i) To strengthen institutional capacities at the Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning (MOFEP), ii) To enhance capacities in Public Finance Management; iii) To improve financial sector asset quality; iv) to provide material resources such as IT equipment and infrastructure; and v) to support Sudan’s efforts towards debt relief. This action will target MOFEP and possibly similar ministries at state-level, as well as other key institutions involved in Public Finance Management (in particular the Central Bank, the Office of the Auditor General and the Bureau of Statistics). It is aligned with the transitional government of Sudan's general framework and the recommendations and commitments made at the Sudan International Partners Forum (SIPF).

A top-up of €22 million to the action was approved in July 2021,bringing the total of the action to €32. This includes:

- €10 million to provide crucial IT infrastructure/equipment to relevant national institutions, and to address other IT needs within the Ministry of Finance. This will enable: i) a faster transition from cash economy to electronic payment systems reducing corruption practices; ii) systemisation of tax collection for improved basic service delivery; iii) improve auditing of companies, and iv) data collection and protection for censuses and surveys.
- €12 million to support to the IMF arrear clearance to reach the Decision Point under the Heavily Indebted Poor Countries Initiative. The Government of Sudan has requested support to clear arrears in the context of a pathway to broader debt clearance under a Highly Indebted Poor Countries (HIPC) initiative, recognising that macro and structural reforms are inevitable to stabilise its economy.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Leather Initiative for Sustainable Employment Creation
summary:
The present proposal is inserted within the EU Action Fiche “_Leather Initiative for Sustainable Employment Creation (LISEC) in Ethiopia_”. The overall objective of the action is to create greater economic and decent employment opportunities, especially for young men and women through the development of the Ethiopian leather industry and the Modjo leather industrial park and Ethiopian leather industry value chain (one of the sectors identified in the Ethiopian's Growth and Transformation Plan II - GTP II as having the potential to boost the growth of the economy). Within this intervention logic, this programme proposes a new vision towards inclusive and sustainable industrial development that protects the environment and supports social inclusion.

In order to achieve the main programme goal, LISEC has been structured following a comprehensive approach with three main components aiming at: (i) Advancing economic competitiveness by strengthening the leather value chain; (ii) Protecting the environment by facilitating financial investments towards the establishment of an eco-friendly leather industrial park in Modjo; and (iii) Strengthening social cohesion by supporting local economic and social development initiatives, especially for women and youth living in Modjo area; and enhancing industrial and labour relations in the MLC. These 3 interlinked components will be coordinated and monitored closely by the EUD under centralized management in coordination with the project PSC.

title: "Technical assistance to Koboko Municipality to implement ‘CRRF: Inclusive Urban Development and Mobility’ Action in Koboko, Uganda'"
summary:
General Objective: To increase safety and well-being of refugees and host communities in Koboko Municipality and reduce inequalities between these groups. 

​

The project targets the limited capacities of Koboko Municipality to deliver services in an inclusive and participatory manner.
