 L'emploi est aujourd'hui la principale préoccupation des jeunes. Il existe peu de formations professionnelles pour les jeunes déscolarisés ; celles qui existent ne sont pas toujours adaptées aux besoins du marché du travail local.
partner_implementing: GRET a Solidarity and International Cooperation Association, Caritas Mauritanie

title: SAFIRE (Consortium Oxfam) Résilience Communautaire et Institutionnelle pour l'Insertion Economique et Sociale des Jeunes et des Femmes à Nouakchott, au Hodh El Chargui et Hodh El Gharbi
summary:
Trait d'union géographique et culturel entre l'Afrique noire et le Maghreb, pays Sahélien situé au bord de l’Océan Atlantique, la Mauritanie est à la fois un pays de transit et de destination des migrants.

Suite aux différentes crises alimentaires et nutritionnelles successives dues notamment à la sècheresse, son milieu rural souffre d'un important exode vers les villes, dans l'espoir de sources de revenus complémentaires, d’emploi voire de migrations transfrontalières.

Le programme SAFIRE a été élaboré en réponse aux problématiques suivantes:

Les dynamiques migratoires : L’exode rural est très important en Mauritanie. Les Migrations sont saisonnières ou de longue durée, internes ou transfrontalières, vers les villes, les pays de la sous-région, l'Europe et l’Amérique. Les migrants entretiennent généralement un lien économique et social important avec leur village d’origine. Les dynamiques migratoires internes représentent ainsi des opportunités économiques insuffisamment valorisées.

Le contexte urbain : Les centres urbains, et particulièrement la ville de Nouakchott, ont connu une croissance démographique exponentielle et rapide depuis quelques décennies.

 Le secteur informel, qui nourrit plus de 80% de la population urbaine en Mauritanie, ne représenterait que 30% de l’économie de Nouakchott.

 L'emploi est aujourd'hui la principale préoccupation des jeunes. Il existe peu de formations professionnelles pour les jeunes déscolarisés ; celles qui existent ne sont pas toujours adaptées aux besoins du marché du travail local.

​
partner_implementing: EU Delegation Mauritania, Association des femmes chefs de famille, OXFAM, Action Contre la Faim, Association mauritanienne pour l'auto-développement, Terre des Hommes, Organisation pour le développement des zones arides et semiarides de Mauritanie, Association de recherches pour le développement en Mauritanie

title: Projet intégré d'appui à la résilience des populations vulnérables réfugiées, déplacées, retournées et hôtes de la région de Diffa, Niger
summary: améliorer les conditions de vie, la résilience des populations vulnérables et la cohésion sociale à travers le relèvement économique, social et gouvernemental de sept communes

title: Programme d'appui à l'intégration socio-économique des jeunes en République de Guinée - INTEGRA GIZ
summary:
L'offre des mesures de formation professionnelle est limitée (quantité) et les employeurs se plaignent que les qualifications des diplômés ne correspondent pas à leurs besoins. Cela s'explique par le fait que la formation comporte peu d'éléments pratiques (qualité). Par rapport aux entrepreneurs eux-mêmes, l’offre de formation – en gestion de l’entreprise, en appui de la création de l’entreprise, - est également insuffisante, notamment en vue de la forte proportion des entreprises type « auto-emplois » dans le secteur informel.

En plus, le système d'enseignement primaire guinéen n'a pas suffisamment préparé les jeunes pour leur transition dans la formation (professionnelle). Une très grande proportion des élèves du primaire quitte l'école primaire sans avoir été orientée sur les possibilités et exigences réelles de formation et d'emploi sur le marché du travail local.

Les thèmes suivants sont donc traités dans la partie GIZ d'INTEGRA :

- Préparation à la vie professionnelle dans les écoles primaires
- Amélioration qualitative et élargissement de l'offre de qualifications professionnelles
- Extension de l'offre de formations pour entrepreneurs

Ces mesures visent à améliorer la capacité d’entraînabilité des élèves du primaire, à améliorer l'employabilité des jeunes et à faciliter l'accès à l'emploi salarié et la création d’auto-emploi fiable.

title: EDUCO Renforcement du Dialogue Social et Religieux
summary: L’action entend ainsi promouvoir des instances d’un dialogue fructueux, endogène et participatif afin de bâtir une cohésion sociale, gage d’une paix durable. L’atteinte de cet objectif passe par des actions de concertation, de promotion de la bonne gouvernance et de mise en place de mécanismes endogènes. REDIRE est complémentaire des initiatives du PUS et du PNDES. Au plan régional, l’action entre en droite ligne avec les Plans Régionaux de Développement 2018-2022 du Nord (axe 3) et du Centre Nord (axe1) pour _« renforcer la gouvernance locale, la participation citoyenne et la coopération décentralisée »_.

title: VSF Revalorisation de l'économie pastorale DJAM
summary: Le projet DJAM s’inscrit dans la stratégie de l’Union Européenne au Burkina Faso qui vise à contribuer à la prévention et à la lutte contre l’extrémisme violent, par la promotion et le renforcement de la cohésion sociale dans le Sahel et le Centre Nord, à travers la promotion du dialogue et la valorisation de l’économie pastorale. Il prend en compte les dynamiques au niveau de l’Etat burkinabé notamment la mise en place du comité mixte du dialogue interreligieux (CMDIR) et la stratégie de lutte contre la radicalisation et l’extrémisme violent. De manière spécifique, le projet DJAM a pour objectif de « **revaloriser dans les**  **zones sensibles les activités liées au pastoralisme de la zone d’intervention dans un environnement de paix et de dialogue intercommunautaire »**.

title: Strengthening Border Security in Ghana
summary:
The project proposes to contribute to reducing irregular migration, by strengthening cooperation at all levels including coordination with neighbouring countries, enhancing border security and by building capacities. This proposal is part of a comprehensive support to the Government of Ghana’s (GoG) migration policy that seeks “_to promote a comprehensive and sustainable approach to migration management which will enhance the potential of migration for Ghana’s development_”[1]. The project will support the 2018 – 2022 GIS Strategic Plan (SP), which includes among others “_contribute to national security by tackling immigration related crimes and detecting and preventing threats at the country’s borders_”.

In addition to the contributions the project hopes to make to national goals, this project will also build upon completed and ongoing initiatives funded by the EU and its Member States. The project aims to provide capacity building as well as the essential equipment needed by the GIS to carry out their duties in a more effective manner.

The support to the GoG targets the key stakeholders in the field of border management, including the Ministry of the Interior (MoI) and the Ministry of Finance (MoF), as well as their relevant departments and agencies. The main counterparts will be:

i. The Ghana Immigration Service (GIS) , whose mandate is to ensure the effective administration and management of migration in the country;

ii. The Ghana Customs Authority in charge of the control of goods;

iii. The National Police carrying out intelligence, information, analytical and operational criminal investigation activities.

[1] National Migration Policy, 2016

title: Boosting green employment and enterprise opportunities in Ghana (GrEEn) - UNCDF
summary:
The action’s overall objective is to contribute to addressing the root causes of irregular migration through green and climate resilient local economic development and to improve prospects of beneficiaries, by increasing access to finance of returnees, youth and women, in selected regions (Ashanti and Western).

The action aims at supporting job creation in regions of departure, transit and return of Ghana, creating local financial ecosystems that facilitate the development of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) and enabling the transition of local economies to green and climate resilient development. Ashanti region is one of the main areas of origin of returned migrants whilst Western Region is increasingly a location many Ghanaian migrants return to; hence, implementation will take place in these regions.

The action will channel finance through performance-based grants to selected Metropolitan, Municipal and District Assemblies (MMDAs) in Ghana. In close collaboration with communities, it will help them develop and implement green and climate resilient local investments that foster employability for returnees, youth and women through cash for work and procurement to local SMEs (Result 1). Simultaneously, the programme will provide skills development support to cash for work beneficiaries of the targeted MMDAs (Result 2), while also promoting access to finance for returnees, youth, women and MSMEs (Result 3). The access to finance component will leverage remittances for community development and private investment. 

The action will be implemented during a period of 48 months in close partnership with the Ministry of Local Government and Rural Development, the Ministry of Finance, and other relevant Ministries, NGOs, the private sector and the International Organisation for Migration (IOM).
partner_implementing: EU Delegation Ghana, United Nations Capital Development Fund

title: Boosting green employment and enterprise opportunities in Ghana (GrEEn) - SNV
summary:
The joint Action’s overall objective is to contribute to addressing the root causes of irregular migration through green and climate resilient local economic development and improving future prospects of beneficiaries, by creating employment and enterprise opportunities in selected sectors and regions. 

Outlined under this full proposal, the action aims at supporting job creation in regions of departure, transit and return of Ghana, creating local ecosystems that facilitate the development of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) and enabling the transition of local economies to green and climate resilient development. Ashanti region is one of the main areas of origin of returned migrants whilst Western Region is increasingly a location many Ghanaian migrants return to. Implementation will therefore take place in these regions. 

The action led by SNV will improve skills development for youth and women as potential migrants, as well as returning migrants in the Ashanti and Western regions of Ghana, through life and employability skills training for employment, coaching and mentoring into (self-)employment or entrepreneurship opportunities and market matching. In addition, the action will support the incubation and/or acceleration of new SMEs or established companies willing to become greener or more inclusive.
partner_implementing: SNV Netherlands Development Organisation, Ghana, EU Delegation Ghana

title: Dismantling the criminal networks operating in North Africa and involved in migrant smuggling and human trafficking
summary: This programme will focus on the regional dimension of fight against smugglers and traffickers. It will target the public sector of the countries in the region (in particular the Ministries of Interior, Justice, Finance, and Health). The overall objective of this programme is to contribute to reducing enablers of - and mitigating vulnerabilities arising from - irregular migration in Algeria, Egypt, Libya, Morocco and Tunisia by focusing on the dismantling of organized criminal groups involved in migrant smuggling and human trafficking.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Libya, EU Delegation to Tunisia, EU Delegation to Algeria, EU Delegation to Egypt
partner_implementing: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

title: MEETAfrica  | Mobilisation européenne pour l'entrepreneuriat en Afrique - Phase 2
summary:
L’Action MEETAfrica – Phase 2, objet du présent dépôt au Comité opérationnel FFU de 2019, répond à l’Objectif 3 « _Œuvrer pour une migration sûre, sans risque, légale et organisé au départ, à destination et au sein de la région et pour une gestion de cette migration fondée sur les droits »_ du Fonds Fiduciaire d’Urgence et en particulier à sa sous-priorité 2 « _Accroitre la migration légale mutuellement bénéfique et la mobilité »._

Dans ce contexte, MEETAfrica 2 vise à favoriser la création d’activités économiques et d’emplois en Afrique par l’accompagnement et le soutien de la diaspora africaine, diplômée ou non (afin de n’exclure aucun projet viable et porteur d’impact) vivant en Europe et/ou nouvellement réinstallés en Afrique dans sa volonté entrepreneuriale. Le projet vise également à fournir un appui additionnel aux entrepreneurs déjà ciblés par MEETAfrica 1. Ce projet vise également le renforcement de l’écosystème d’appui à l’entrepreneuriat des diasporas, véritable nouveauté de la phase 2.

title: Multi-Educational Programme for Employment Promotion in Migration-affected areas (MEPEP)
summary:
The Multi-Educational Programme for Employment Promotion in Migration-affected Areas (MEPEP) falls under the scope of the “Enhancing the Response to Migration Challenges in Egypt Programme (ERMCE, Ref. T05-EUTF-NOA-EG-01) which is funded by the European Union Emergency Trust Fund for stability and addressing the root causes of irregular migration and displaced persons in Africa.

The MEPEP is aligned to the Operational framework of the EU TF North Africa Window (EU TF NOA), namely to its Priority Action 4 (i.e. "tackling the drivers of irregular migration") and its Strategic Objective 4 (i.e. "to foster more inclusive social and economic environment and stability in the region").

It is linked to the Specific Objective 2 of the ERMCE Action fiche (Ref. T05-EUTF-NOA-EG-01), i.e. "to address the root causes of irregular migration".

With a planned three-year duration, the Action aims at enhancing economic and equal opportunities, in particular for vulnerable groups by improving the quality of the Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) system in Egypt.
partner_implementing: Agenzia italiana per la cooperazione allo sviluppo

title: Recovery, Stability and socio-economic development in Libya
summary:
The overall objective of this intervention is to improve the living conditions and resilience of vulnerable children and youth (including migrants, refugees, Internally Displaced Persons, returnees and host communities) and their families and support local governance in the targeted municipalities most affected by migratory flows, through enhancing access to basic and social services in particular Health, Education, Child Protection and Water and Sanitation.

Specific objectives are:

- To strengthen the capacities of the municipal authorities in providing basic and social services in Health, Education, Child Protection and Water and Sanitation in the targeted municipalities;
- To improve access to quality basic and social services, vulnerable children and their families living in the targeted municipalities (including migrants, refugees, Internally Displaced Persons, returnees and host communities).

title: Strengthening Local Capacities for Resilience and Recovery (SLCRR Top-up)
summary:
‘Strengthening Local Capacities for Resilience and Recovery’ (SLCRR) is a three-year action aiming at supporting local authorities in Libya to respond to the many conflict and human mobility induced challenges - by strengthening the local resilience and recovery mechanisms - that impact negatively people access to essential services, the social cohesion and community security, and jobs and the sustainable livelihoods.

The overall objective of the project is to improve the living conditions and resilience of vulnerable populations (including migrants, refugees, IDPs, returnees and host communities), in particular in the municipalities most affected by migratory flowand/or affected by the conflict.

The project is built around 3 specific objectives: (1) Strengthening responsiveness of local institutions in delivering essential public services to crisis-affected populations and in leading recovery processes; (2) Enhancing communities and local stakeholders’ capacity to improve social cohesion and community security; (3) Strengthening economic opportunities for youth and vulnerable groups (including women) through inclusive and participatory local economic recovery. 

This action will be implemented by UNDP in 20 selected municipalities and communities across the country. The municipalities selected in agreement with theMinistry of Local Governance (MoLG) are the following: Al Qala , Al Zahra, Derej, Ghadames, Jufra, Mslat/Msallata, Nalut, Baten Al Jabal, Alryaynah, Qasr Alkhyar for the West; Al Brega, Mrada, Robyana, Tobruk, Jalu (including Jaghra, and Ojla), Tazerbo for the East; Achargya, Al Grefa, Bint Baya, Idri Achati for the South.

title: Supporting communities – health for all
summary:
The Action will provide better community access to primary and secondary health care through mobile health teams (_medical convoys_ as per ERC definition) positioned directly within the identified living areas of the target population. Furthermore, Community Based Health and First Aid (CBHFA) courses for community members will be conducted by ERC to build upon the identified potential within the target community to establish a network (and/or strengthen the existing ones) of Community Health Volunteers (CHV).

This Action aims to strengthen and complement current national efforts and existing community initiatives. The interventions at community level are developed and delivered as extension of and in accordance with national policies, programs and standards to strengthen cooperation and dialogue between the communities and the authorities. ERC has a unique position to facilitate this link by being thoroughly anchored at community level on the one hand, as well as being well connected with government stakeholders, according to its mandate as auxiliary to the state, on the other.

title: Support to integrated Border and migration management in Libya - second phase
TOP UP: Managing mixed migration flows: Enhancing protection and assistance for those in need in Libya
summary:
Overall objective is to strengthen protection and resilience of vulnerable migrants and migrants at risk, refugees and host communities (including IDPs and returnees) in Libya. 

Specific objectives of this intervention are:

1. Improved direct multi-sectoral assistance and protection to migrants, refugees and host communities in different locations inside Libya, in particular inside detention centres, at disembarkation points and in urban settings. 

2. Improved protection of stranded and vulnerable persons of concern to UNHCR through emergency evacuations out of Libya
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Recovery, Stability and Socio-economic Development in Libya
summary: This Action aims to support Libyan Municipalities in providing inclusive access to basic and social services (health, education, water and sanitation, energy/electric power) by strengthening their technical capacities with the purpose of rebuilding a sense of community and trust, laying the foundations for community reconciliation and healing - and thereby better managing migratory flows. The rehabilitation of service facilities, combined with capacity building and awareness raising activities, is expected to contribute to inclusive access and better quality of services rendered to beneficiaries

title: Strengthening Local Capacities for Resilience and Recovery
summary:
“Strengthening Local Capacities for Resilience and Recovery” is a multi-phase, multi-year project that is directly implemented by UNDP Libya and funded mainly by the European Union. The first phase of the project focuses on supporting local authorities in Libya to respond to the many conflict and human mobility induced challenges - by strengthening the local resilience and recovery mechanisms - that impact negatively citizens' access to essential services, sources of livelihoods, the social cohesion and security of communities. 11 municipalities are supported in the first phase, including 6 municipalities in Greater Tripoli, in addition to Sabratha, Sabha, Murzuq, Benghazi, Ajdabiya and Al Kufra.

This action is the **second phase** and aims at enhancing provision of basic services at local level and increasing access for most vulnerable groups from host communities – including Internally Displaced Populations (IDPs) and returnees – as well as migrants and refugees. 20 municipalities are receiving support through the second phase that is being implemented across the three regions of Libya, West, East and South. This second phase is implemented in close cooperation with the Ministry of Local Governance, Municipalities, UNICEF and Italian Agency for Development Cooperation (AICS).

title: Integrated approach to protection and emergency assistance to vulnerable and stranded migrants in Libya
summary: This action is a comprehensive approach to the provision of assistance through protection, based on several aspects of vulnerabilities persons caught in the mixed migration flow in Libya are faced with. It starts with life-saving assistance provided at disembarkation points after migrants are rescued/intercepted at sea, focuses on advocacy through increased capacity building for Libyan authorities, supports most vulnerable persons in detention centres and offering basic life-saving assistance to persons outside of detention through activities such as the operation of Safe Houses and Community Day Centres for registered refugees and asylum seekers in urban areas of Tripoli, and concludes with the implementation of small scale Quick Impact Projects benefitting migrants, internally displaced persons and returnees as well as the host communities.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Enhancing migration management through institutional support
summary:
Under this project, Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation (AECID) will support the Egyptian authorities in implementing necessary actions aiming to achieve the objectives of the National Strategy for combating and preventing irregular migration, as well as human trafficking.

Spain knows from its own experience that migration policies must form an integral part of overall national policies and strategies in a coherent manner. Furthermore, it is important to have solid institutions with enough capacity to cope with the migration challenge in a coordinated manner. From this intense migratory experience, Spain can extrapolate a set of lessons learned regarding migration management in general and the extent to which migration can contribute to a society. Spain is willing to share those lessons learned with the counterparts from Egyptian administration.

To this end, **peer to peer cooperation**has been identified as the appropriate approach to exchange the knowledge and expertise and to create or upgrade capacities in Egypt. The peer to peer cooperation for this projectwill be established with **four institutions of the Egyptian Government as the main beneficiaries**, being led by the National Coordinating Committee on Combatting and Preventing Illegal Migration and Trafficking in Person(NCCPIM&TIP), main counterpart for this initiative. Based on its mandate within the Egyptian administration, each institution will be a main counterpart and beneficiary for a specific project component as follows:

a) **NCCPIM&TIP is main counterpart for the component on inter-Ministerial coordination, capacity building and awareness campaigns.**

b) **Ministry of Manpower** is main counterpart for **Labor migration and Mobility**component**.**

c) **Data**,**Statistics and Studies**component is having**CAPMAS**as main counterpart**.**

d) **National Council for Human Rights** is the main counterpart for **Human Rights**component.
partner_implementing: Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation

title: Capacity Building through Urban Infrastructure Development in migration-affected urban areas (CBUID)
summary:
The Capacity Building through Urban Infrastructure Development Project (CBUID) aims at enhancing the economic and equal opportunities for local population groups most at risk of migrating irregularly, most vulnerable, or living in disadvantaged areas. This will be addressed through the creation of employment and skills development opportunities in conjunction with infrastructural improvements in migration-prone informal settlements. This goal will be pursued holistically through a labour-intensive infrastructure upgrading project in the target governorates, including Alexandria, Asyut, and Beheira. This will lead to an enhanced standard of living for the inhabitants of disadvantaged urban areas affected by migration. The action includes employment in infrastructure rehabilitation processes and skill development and measures to promote employment for those living in informal settlements.

 Implemented by Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) on behalf of the German Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ), the action is co-funded by European Union Emergency Trust Fund for stability and addressing root causes of irregular migration and displaced persons in Africa (EUTF). This project is a new action, which will merge financing from Germany with funds from the European Union.
partner_funding: Bundesministerium fur wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung

title: Phase II
summary: The action aims to strengthening the resilience of migrants and displaced populations together with their host communities, by applying a Rights-Based Approach to addressing challenges to socio-economic integration and promoting a culture of rights, dialogue and social cohesion.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Libya, EU Delegation to Tunisia, EU Delegation to Algeria, EU Delegation to Egypt

title: Déploiement des Politiques Migratoires au Niveau Régional
summary: Le projet a comme objectif de «renforcer la gouvernance et la mise en œuvre des politiques migratoires au niveau régional». Il vise plus spécifiquement l'intégration des deux politiques migratoires que sont la SNIA et la SNMRE dans le développement local au Maroc au profit à la fois des Marocains Résidant à l'Étranger et des immigrés régularisés au Maroc et ce, dans trois régions pilotes que sont les régions de Beni Mellal-Khénifra, de l’Oriental et du Souss-Massa. A noter que les activités relatives au renforcement de capacité intervenant sur la question migratoire concerneront aussi la région de Tanger-Tétouan.

title: Addressing root causes of irregular migration through employability and labour intensive works (ELIW)
summary:
The project purpose is a response to the phenomenon of irregular migration of youth by tackling the deteriorating living conditions ias well as the lack of economic opportunities and employment in Egypt. These problems will be addressed through creating short and medium term employment, and building skills of unemployed youth in response to the current economic crisis with a view to expanding and diversifying their employment perspectives. The project will also contribute to improving the physical and social infrastructures in the target areas to provide a better quality of life for the local communities.

The implementing organisation of this project, the _**Micro & Small & Medium Entrepreneurship Development Agency **_**(MSMEDA).**
partner_implementing: Medium & Small & Micro Entrepreneurship Development Agency

title: Soutien à la gestion intégrée des frontières et de la migration au Maroc
summary:
Le double objectif de cette action consiste à renforcer les capacités marocaines à gérer leurs
 frontières maritimes et à assurer des sauvetages en mer et la protection des migrants
 vulnérables, dans le respect des normes internationales et des obligations en matière de droits
 de l’homme. Cela devrait faciliter les déplacements des voyageurs de bonne foi.
 Le trafic de migrants et la traite des êtres humains sont deux défis majeurs étroitement liés à la
 gestion intégrée des frontières et des migrations dans ce contexte. Par conséquent, le
 programme inclura des considérations spécifiques visant à renforcer les capacités marocaines
 de lutte contre les activités criminelles transfrontalières et les réseaux criminels organisés.
 Cette action couvrira notamment :
 · Le soutien des services de sécurité en matière de lutte contre la migration irrégulière
 ainsi que la fourniture des équipements pour renforcer les efforts de lutte déjà engagés.
 · Soutien au renforcement des capacités nécessaires dans le domaine de la lutte contre le
 trafic de migrants et la traite des êtres humains.
partner_implementing: Fundación Internacional y para Iberoamérica de Administración y Políticas Públicas

title: PEERS: Protection Enabling Environment and Resilience Services
summary:
As part of the continued efforts to strengthen protection and resilience of conflict-affected population across Libya, the proposed project is designed in consortium by Cesvi and International Medical Corps (IMC)capitalizing on the in-depth work already undertaken in 2018 and 2019 to address the protection and health needs of vulnerable migrants, refugees and host communities including Internal Displaced Persons (IDPs) and Returnees, in detention centers (DCs) and urban communities in Western Libya.

The project is in line with Libya 2019 Humanitarian Response Plan (HRP) and its revision - as a result of the eruption of the clashes in Tripoli, to support the evolving needs of vulnerable people affected by the conflict.
partner_extending: International Medical Corps

title: Expanding Protection Environment and Services for Mixed Migration Flows and Vulnerable Libyans along Migration Routes in Libya and Supporting Local Socio-Economic Stabilization
summary: This Action falls under the Programme "_Managing mixed migration flows: Enhancing protection and assistance for those in need in Libya_" (T05- EUTF-NOA-LY-08) under the European Union Emergency Trust Fund for stability and addressing the rootcauses of irregular migration and displaced persons in Africa (i.e. “Trust Fund”, EUTF).

title: Improving Overall Resilience of Migrants and Host Communities through Improved Access to Quality Health Services in Libya
summary: Through the proposed Action, the IRC, in coordination with other health actors, will aim to increase access to high quality health care for migrants outside detention centres, vulnerable groups and the hosting population, also providing streamlined MHPSS and reproductive health services alongside general preventive and curative medical consultations.

title: Towards a Holistic Approach to Labour Migration Governance and Labour Mobility in North Africa
summary: The programme will contribute to improving the governance of labour migration and the protection of migrant workers in the North of Africa by supporting the development and implementation of coherent and comprehensive policy frameworks guided by relevant human rights and labour standards and based on reliable data and evidence. These are essential for fair and effective labour migration governance and decent work. In addition, it will contribute to preparing, putting in place or improving legal migration and mobility schemes in cooperation with selected North African countries – Egypt, Morocco and Tunisia – and EU Member States, in particular Germany.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, Bundesministerium fur wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Tunisia, EU Delegation to Egypt, EU Delegation to Morocco

title: Coopération Sud-Sud en matière de migration
summary:
L’Action de Coopération Sud-Sud en matière de migration vise à accompagner le Maroc, à travers le _Ministère Délégué auprès du Ministre des Affaires Étrangères, de la Coopération Africaine et des Marocains Résidant à l’étranger Chargé des Marocains résidant à l’Étranger (MDCMRE)_, et respectivement la Côte d’Ivoire, le Mali et le Sénégal, dans la mise en œuvre de Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) entre le Maroc et les trois pays, afin de concrétiser les engagements réciproques pris en matière de migration. Le Maroc a établi avec les trois pays partenaires des plans d’actions conjoints.

L’Action de Coopération Sud-Sud mobilise une expertise nationale et internationale dans chacun des quatre pays afin de soutenir et renforcer le dialogue et la coopération entre les parties prenantes et contribuer à la mise en œuvre d’actions relatives aux domaines suivants :

• Migration et développement, en particulier sous l’aspect des politiques et pratiques de mobilisation des diasporas, aux niveaux national, régional, et local

• Accès aux droits des migrants, notamment via des actions d’intégration et de réintégration économiques et sociales

• Mobilité Sud-Sud, dans le cadre d’une approche triple gagnante (pays d’origine, pays d’accueil et migrants) traduite par des actions favorisant la mobilité régulière

La collaboration entre le Maroc et trois pays d’Afrique de l’Ouest représente un important potentiel d’apprentissage mutuel et vise à la mise en place d’une gouvernance sous-régionale en matière de migration

Cette Action est co-financée par l’Union Européenne et le Ministère allemand fédéral de la Coopération économique et du Développement (BMZ). Elle est mise en œuvre par la « Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit » (GIZ) et « Expertise France » (EF).

title: A Testcase ICMPD EUTF NoA

title: Tumuhaire Raymond
summary: The Green Future Farm Project will be implemented in Eastern Uganda around Mount Elgon region in Kween, Kapchorwa and Bukwo districts. It will contribute towards improved landscape restoration, circular regenerative agriculture and innovative ways to capitalize on local value chains creating more rewarding livelihoods. The project will contribute directly to SDGs 1 and 8 (by providing opportunities for poverty reduction and economic growth), 6 and 15 (particularly the targets on restoration of ecosystems and landscapes).

title: Make it in The Gambia - IMVF
summary: Overall objective is to contribute to socio-economic development and to nurture positive prospects for local populations and returning migrants in The Gambia, namely in Central River, North Bank, Lower River and Upper River regions.
partner_implementing: Instituto Marquês de Valle Flôr, EU Delegation Gambia

title: Enhancing self-reliance and access to rights for refugees and asylum-seekers in North Africa
summary: The purpose of this Action is to provide refugees and asylum-seekers in three North African countries (Egypt, Morocco and Tunisia) with access to legal assistance, self-reliance, education and services that address particular vulnerabilities such as sexual and gender-based violence. These activities aim to increase refugee integration into host communities while reducing exposure to risks associated with onward movements. Further, UNHCR also integrates in this Action support to host government through capacity building and integration efforts of refugees and asylum-seekers in Tunisia.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Tunisia, EU Delegation to Egypt

title: TOP-UP Technical Cooperation Facility (TCF): Formulation of programmes, Implementation of the  Monitoring and Evaluation Framework, Communication and Research activities
summary:
This Action consists of a top-up of the existing Technical Cooperation Facility. 
The Action has a regional coverage, comprising the five eligible countries under the EUTFNOA. 
The overall objective is to increase the effectiveness of the EUTF-NOA by strengthening the monitoring and evaluation framework of the window, as well as improving communication and visibility on the results achieved through these Actions and enhancing the knowledge and understanding of the root causes of instability, insecurity, irregular migration and forced displacement. It is to be noted that this Action comprises a top-up of the existing TCF for the EUTF for Africa. Due to specific needs in the region, it has been agreed that the EUTF-NOA would need a top-up in order to cover specific window needs for feasibility, monitoring, evaluation, communication and research needs.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Egypt, EU Delegation to Libya, EU Delegation to Algeria, EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Tunisia

title: MEETAfrica  | Mobilisation européenne pour l'entrepreneuriat en Afrique - Phase 2
summary: MEETAfrica 2 vise à favoriser la création d’activités économiques et d’emplois en Afrique par l’accompagnement et le soutien de la diaspora africaine, diplômée ou non afin de n’exclure aucun projet viable et porteur d’impact, vivant en Europe et/ou nouvellement réinstallés en Afrique dans sa volonté entrepreneuriale. Le projet vise également à fournir un appui additionnel aux entrepreneurs déjà ciblés par MEETAfrica 1. Ce projet vise également le renforcement de la filière d’appui à l’entrepreneuriat des diasporas, véritable nouveauté de la phase 2.
partner_funding: Agence Française de Développement, EU Trust Fund for Africa
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Tunisia

title: DEV-pillar of the Regional Development and Protection Programme in the North of Africa – Phase III
summary: The Regional Development and Protection Programme (i.e. "RDPP") fully incorporates this reinforced developmental, inclusive and integrated approach to forced displacement. This Action will support the development pillar of the RDPP in the North of Africa, by contributing to the establishment or reinforcement of inclusive services, fostering social cohesion and employment opportunities at community/decentralized levels. The Action concerns all five countries in the North of Africa region: Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia, Libya and Egypt. For Algeria no concrete activities have been conceived for now.  This third phase of the RDPP Development pillar, running in parallel with the second phase (implemented by IOM and Safe the Children) and building on the first phase (implemented by IOM), will exclusively comprise a CSO component, mainly targeting international CSOs who can subcontract local CSOs (while not precluding contracting local CSOs directly, where this may be feasible). Grants will be awarded for the timespan of three consecutive years. Activities will build on the relevant parts of the needs assessment of the first phase of the RDPP development pillar.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Algeria, EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Libya, EU Delegation to Egypt, EU Delegation to Tunisia
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Strengthening the ability of IGAD to promote resilience in the Horn of Africa (KPMG)
summary:
This services contract includes :
1) Preparation of IGAD IPSAS Policy Framework based on particular standards and conceptual framework of IPSAS. The consultant will review and evaluate IGAD policies/ manuals and realignment to IPSAS framework.  
2) Review of the accounting, procurement, internal audit and human resource systems used by IGAD (Secretariat and all specialised offices) for IPSAS compliance and make appropriate recommendations in line with international best practice and standards;  
3) Review of the updated IGAD Service Regulations that includes processes for improved staff recruitment, staff evaluation, leave management, performance and promotion systems, training needs as well as outsourcing and the use of external consultancies 
4) Provision of technical support to IGAD in accounting procedures to align with IPSAS and provision of technical training on the applicable IPSAS standards as well as awareness training for IGAD staff. 
5) Provision of support to the technical committee in the enhancement of the capacity of the core IPSAS implementation structures (technical committee and project steering committee) including the transition to full implementation and adoption of IPSAS.  
6) Provision of technical support to the project implementation committees in the development of other control documents and schedules that will support the implementation of IPSAS.
7) Provision of technical support to enable IGAD prepare IPSAS compliant financial statements and reports. 
8) Provision of required policy and technical guidance to the management and staff in all areas identified in the gap analysis towards standardization of the system. 
9) Building the capacity of lGAD staff with required knowledge of IPSAS Standards in the implementation process.
10) Monitoring progress in the implementation process, provide hands-on technical support to staff and make any appropriate adjustments.
partner_implementing: KPMG Kenya, KPMG Kenya, KPMG Kenya, EU Delegation Djibouti, KPMG Kenya
recipient_country: DJ, ET, KE, SD, SO, SS, UG

title: Evaluation à mi-parcours: Projet TRANSFORM - Professionnaliser les jeunes et les professionnels de la filière transport-logistique-portuaire (EURONET)
summary: Evaluation à mi-parcours de l'action TRANSFORM dans son intégralité.

title: TOP UP: Strengthening Local Capacities for Resilience and Recovery
summary:
The programme "TOP UP: Strengthening Local Capacities for Resilience and Recovery" aims to improve the living conditions and resilience of vulnerable populations (including migrants, refugees, IDPs, returnees and host communities), in particular in the municipalities most affected by migratory flows and/or damaged by the conflict. 
The programmes builds on the approach and the objectives set under the "Local Governance and socio-economic development Pillar' of the programme Managing mixed migration flows in Libya through supporting local socioeconomic development" (T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-03), and expands geographically and financially the EU support to this pillar. More specifically, it is a top-up of the Action "Strengthening Local Capacities and Resilience in Libya (SLCRR)" currently carried out by UNDP at an implementation pace more rapid than planned.

The verification shall result in report of factual findings.

title: Programme Jeunesse et Stabilisation – PROJES – régions du centre du Mali
summary:
Le PROJES est d’abord conçu comme un programme de stabilisation humaine, dans une zone d’intervention soumise à de fortes pressions multidimensionnelles, dont sécuritaires.
 
Il propose ainsi des modes opératoires d’intervention plaçant les acteurs locaux et leurs besoins au cœur de l’intervention selon une approche bottom-up, approche qui permet également de renforcer l’acceptation du Programme par les parties prenantes locales. Le Programme fixe ainsi une méthodologie, des objectifs et des résultats à atteindre mais laisse en grande partie la définition du contenu des activités émerger des phases d’identification et de concertation. 

Le PROJES cible par ailleurs la jeunesse, filles et garçons, comme bénéficiaire privilégié du Programme.  

Face à l’enjeu de l’insertion des jeunes au Mali, les partenaires techniques et financiers sont questionnés dans leur capacité à apporter des réponses de développement adaptées, en ligne avec les politiques publiques et la demande sociale. Ceci implique de repenser les modes d’intervention en faveur des jeunes, dans un souci d’adaptation aux évolutions socio-économiques et sécuritaires du pays.
En effet, les dynamiques d’exclusion de la jeunesse se présentent sous une forme pluridimensionnelle et doivent être analysées en regard des contextes particuliers. Elles se manifestent dans différentes sphères : accès aux services publics, au système légal, à une éducation ou à des institutions sociales, comme l’accès à la propriété et à un emploi. Mais elles peuvent également se traduire par une sous-représentation politique, un manque de reconnaissance ou de respect. Le sentiment d’exclusion alimente aussi bien des dynamiques de marginalisation (une jeunesse qui ne contribue pas activement à la cohésion sociale et au développement économique), de migrations, que le choix de la violence comme moyen d’expression.

title: TOP UP: Managing mixed migration flows: Enhancing protection and assistance for those in need in Libya
summary:
The programme 'TOP-UP Managing mixed migration flows: Enhancing protection and assistance for those in need in Libya' aims to strengthen protection and resilience of vulnerable migrants and migrants at risk, refugees and host communities (including Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and returnees) in Libya, while supporting efforts to improve migration management along the migration routes in the country.
This programme aims to continue to support interventions in particular under the Programme "Managing mixed migration flows in Libya through expanding protection space and supporting local socio-economic development" (T05-EUTF-NOA-LY-03). 
This programme benefits from a co-funding from UNHCR.
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, United Nations Population Fund, CESVI
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Solutions perennes sociales pour les populations hotes, les refugies et les migrants les plus vulnerables sur le territoire djiboutien (PAM)
summary:
L'objectif global du projet est de renforcer le système des filets de sécurité sociale de l'Etat dans le cadre des moyens de subsistence et de la couverture médicale gratuite, y compris les engagements pris par le Gouvernement dans le cadre du CRRF, en fournissant des solutions pérennes dans la provision de services sociaux de base pour les individus les plus vulnérables présents sur le territoire djiboutien. 

La logique d'intervention de l’action s’articule autour du principe de l’importance de la continuité des actions menées conjointement par le PAM et le Secrétariat d’Etat aux Affaires Sociales (SEAS) plus spécifiquement dans le cadre de la mise en œuvre de la stratégie nationale de protection sociale couvrant la période 2018-2022. Le bon fonctionnement du système de protection sociale djiboutien – surtout en termes des provisions de moyens de subsistance et de la couverture médicale gratuite pour les individus dont les seuils de pauvreté sont les plus bas – permettrait à l’Etat de mieux gérer les flux migratoires mixtes, et de prévenir les tensions sociales inhérentes au partage et à l'accès aux services de base.

La composante Programme National de Solidarité Famille (PNSF) ne sera pas limitée uniquement aux transferts monétaires, mais visera à favoriser un changement des comportements dans les domaines de la nutrition et la santé de base grâce à la mise en place de mesures d’accompagnement pour les ménages ciblés. Il s’agira entre autres d’offrir un paquet de prestations sociales à différents niveaux, notamment à la création des coopératives et la formation professionnelle pour une proportion de la population bénéficiaire du PNSF dans les milieux urbains dans l’optique de développer des opportunités des créations d’emploi.
partner_implementing: WORLD FOOD PROGRAM - WFP - KENYA OFFICE

title: Kenya EU Partnership for the implementation of the Kenya CVE Strategy
Quality Learning environment for access and retention (EQUIP-QLEAR)
Education Quality Improvement Programme through improving learning environment and retention (EQUIP-I-LEARN)
Programme de création d‘emplois et d’opportunités économiques à travers une gestion durable de l’environnement dans les zones de départ et de transit au Niger
summary: La présente Action a comme porte d’entrée la réalisation d’investissements hydro-agricoles et socioéconomiques structurants.. L’action appuiera en priorité la production agricole en veillant à ce que ses producteurs s’intègrent dans des chaînes de valeur en cours de création. Elle renforcera dans ce cadre des organisations paysannes afin qu’elles puissent organiser des services pour leurs membres dont des activités de conservation, de petite transformation et de commercialisation des filières choisies. Les infrastructures sélectionnées seront réalisées suivant une approche à haute intensité de main d’œuvre (HIMO) accompagnée de chantiers école et de formation continue. Ces ouvrages devraient être réalisés sur deux zones de concentration : le bassin de Gafati autour des barrages de Kassama et de Toumbala, d’une part, et le bassin de Kantché, d’autre part.

title: Appui a La Lutte Contre La Traite Des Personnes Dans Les Pays Du Golfe De Guinée
summary: L'approche multi-pays retenue (Bénin, Cameroun, Côte d’Ivoire, Ghana, Nigeria et Togo), prenant en compte les spécificités de chaque pays, n'occulte pas les problématiques communes auxquels font face les pays ciblés. Le renforcement et la dynamisation des dispositifs nationaux de lutte contre la traite constituent un point d'entrée nécessaire, qu’il s’agisse de la mise en place de mécanismes efficaces de coordination au niveau national et dans les territoires (objectif spécifique 1). Cet effort doit s'accompagner de l’appropriation de cadres législatifs récents et en développement par les différentes unités spécialisées, et de la mise en application de ces cadres par le renforcement des capacités au niveau judiciaire comme à celui des moyens et des compétences des forces de sécurité concernées (objectif spécifique 2). La structuration et la normalisation de services spécialisés et de droit commun en mesure de répondre aux besoins spécifiques des victimes de la traite (objectif spécifique 3) constituent un troisième pilier d’intervention.

title: Les jeunes entreprennent et s’emploient au Niger
summary: Plus spécifiquement, l’Action s’inscrit dans le premier secteur « Sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle, résilience », qui vise l'augmentation de la disponibilité des denrées alimentaires et des revenus à travers l'accroissement d'une production communautaire ou individuelle durable, par une meilleure maîtrise de l'eau, le renforcement des capacités de prévention et de réponse face aux situations d'insécurité alimentaire, l'amélioration de l'état nutritionnel des ménages vulnérables, et le renforcement des capacités des institutions publiques et professionnelles. En rapport avec le troisième secteur du PIN « Sécurité, bonne gouvernance et consolidation de la paix », l’Action proposée appuiera les collectivités territoriales (Communes et Régions dans le cadre décentralisé) dans des initiatives sociales et économiques en faveur de leurs communautés, en particulier des jeunes sans emploi qui, sans aucune perspective, peuvent être attirés par la migration, le banditisme, les trafics illicites ou la collaboration avec des groupes terroristes. L’appui à des initiatives décentralisées, visant une stabilité à base sociale et économique, permettra d’affirmer et de crédibiliser les missions de ces entités démocratiques, notamment en ce qui concerne la présence et l'assistance des services déconcentrés de l'État et l'implication des organisations de la société civile.

title: Investissement de la diaspora dans l'entreprenariat durable des jeunes ruraux au Mali
summary: L’action développée visera, dans un premier temps, à combler le manque de connaissance sur l’amplitude et les caractéristiques de l’investissement de la diaspora malienne ainsi que sur son organisation et ses capacités d’intervention en Europe. Elle participera à la construction d’une prise de conscience et à une prise de décision mieux informée des décideurs publics et des acteurs du secteur privé en vue de faire levier sur cette manne financière et cet engagement solidaire. Les éléments d’information collectés sur les modes d’investissement de la diaspora alimenteront également la conception et la mise en œuvre de deux mécanismes de mobilisation de l’investissement de la diaspora : (i) une plateforme de prêt solidaire permettant aux membres de la diaspora de financer de jeunes entrepreneurs ruraux maliens et (ii) la participation d’un collège de la diaspora malienne à un fonds d’investissement à impact finançant des PME maliennes. En cohérence avec la politique nationale de migration du Mali et en synergies avec les actions menées par l’UE au Mali sur les questions de migration et développement et celles de ses partenaires, notamment l’AFD, l’ensemble des activités menées convergeront vers l’apport d’un financement additionnel en faveur des jeunes entrepreneurs ruraux et, plus généralement, de l’emploi des jeunes ruraux. Partant, l’action contribuera à apporter des éléments de réponses aux causes profondes des migrations en zone rurale.

title: Durabilité de l’Environnement et Stabilisation Economique sur la Route de Transit (D.E.S.E.R.T.)
partner_implementing: Agenzia italiana per la cooperazione allo sviluppo

title: Enhancing protection, live-saving assistance and solutions, including resettlement for persons of concern with international protection needs in Libya and West Africa (Niger and Burkina Faso)
summary: The present action proposes the establishment of an Evacuation Transit Mechanism (ETM) in Niger to facilitate the finding of swift solutions for persons of concern with urgent protection needs in Libya. It also integrates a new component which follows the EU-AU-UN meeting at the Abidjan Summit end of November 2017, which took decisive actions in regard to the difficult situation for people in transit in Libya. This new component is about the emergency evacuation of some 3,800 persons from Libya to Niger and possibly 550 to Burkina Faso with a view to onward resettlement or other durable solutions as applicable. It also seeks to scale up the scope for solutions for persons in need of international protection in selected West African countries.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
partner_accountable: EU Delegation Niger, EU Delegation Burkina Faso
partner_implementing: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

title: Erasmus + in West Africa
summary:
In the framework of the Valletta Summit on 11-12 November 2015, European and African leaders discussed the European migration situation. The Summit resulted in the adoption of a Political Declaration and Action Plan with over 90 actions including 16 flagship initiatives. One of these 16 flagship initiatives agreed upon at the Summit consisted in doubling "the number of scholarships for students and academic staff through the EU supported Erasmus+ programme in 2016 compared to 2014". Further to the success of this flagship initiative, it is anticipated to increase significantly the number of beneficiaries through the international dimension of Erasmus+.
The external dimension of Erasmus+ aims to support Partner Countries (i.e. countries in the world that participate in some actions of Erasmus+ without contributing financially to the programme) to deal with the challenges facing their higher education institutions and systems, including those of quality, relevance, equity of access, planning, delivery, management, governance and internationalisation by offering a balanced mix of actions addressing individuals, institutions and higher education systems. 
Through its international credit mobility – ICM action (student mobility between 3 and 12 months to obtain credits in a partner host institution, which are then recognised by the country home institution and; staff mobility), Erasmus+ has an impact on the personal development and employability of students but also a structured and sustainable impact on universities.
recipient_country: BF, CI, CM, GH, GM, GN, ML, MR, NE, NG, SN, TD

title: EU Support to the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) ‘Regional Stabilisation Facility for Lake Chad’ (RSF)
summary:
The European Union (EU) as well as other donors will support the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) to create a ‘Regional Stabilisation Facility for Lake Chad’ (RSF) with the objective to stabilise the Boko Haram affected areas of the Lake Chad Basin. The Facility will consist in a multiscale multi-country mechanism with activities covering stabilisation and recovery, security, development and institutional support. The current budget estimate amounts to USD 100 million from 2019 to 2021. 

This EUR 5 million action funded under the ‘EU Trust Fund for Emergency in Africa’ aims to contribute to the immediate stabilisation of the insurgency-affected areas of the Lake Chad Basin, notably through the strengthening of Security and the Rule of Law. The programme ambitions to reflect the ‘integrated approach’ to security and development by supporting both the redeployment of Security Forces and Law Enforcement Agencies in insurgency-affected areas while improving their relations with local populations in order to open the way for stabilisation and recovery in the region.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Somalia UN Multi-Partner Trust Fund
summary:
This project consists of  EU's support to several programmes agreed within the National Development Programme, the Wadajir Framework for Local Governance and the Comprehensive Approach to Security, including the relevant multilateral thematic groups (Rule of Law working group – CAS 2C, Internal Security CAS 2B and Pillar Working Group 3 on Building Effective and Efficient Institutions. 
The programmes are: 
1. Somalia Joint Justice Programme (JJP)
2. Somalia Joint Corrections Services Support Programme (JCP)
3. Security Sector Governance Programme (SSGP)
4. Joint Programme on Local Governance and decentralized service delivery (JPLG III).
partner_implementing: EU Delegation Somalia, United Nations Development Programme

title: Response to increased demand on Government Service and creation of economic opportunities in Uganda (RISE) - Emergency Preparedness component - CARE
summary: With a continuing influx of refugees from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) to the refugee settlements in South Western Uganda, there is an urgent need for the local governments in the refugee hosting Districts to increase their capacity to lead in the response. This is particularly the case in the new District of Kikuube, which was only established in June 2018, and is hosting the fast-growing settlement of Kyangwali. As of October 31st the settlement hosted 76,717 refugees, but that number is expected to grow with as much as 30,000 more in the coming weeks and months due to the potential increase in the DRC refugee influx. As a new District Kikuube has even less capacity to respond to the continued influx of refugees than other Districts, and there is therefore a critical need for strengthening the District’s service delivery capacity in critical areas such as education, lifesaving health services and natural environment management. The proposed Action will contribute to filling some of the most critical humanitarian gaps with the District while building its humanitarian preparedness capacity.

title: Appui aux forces de sécurité des pays membres du G5 Sahel pour la lutte contre l’impunité et le renforcement de leurs liens avec les populations
summary: Dans un contexte sécuritaire aggravé, on constate une dégradation du lien entre populations locales et Forces de Défenses et Sécurité (FDS). La recrudescence des violences armées, la multiplication de conflits intercommunautaires liés à la présence de milices, l’absence de l’Etat de certaines zones déjà fragiles ont menés à la perpétration de séries d’exactions contre les populations locales pour lesquelles certaines forces de défense et de sécurité ont pu être soupçonnées. Face à ce constat, l’Union Européenne a décidé d’agir urgemment avec l’adoption de ce programme de soutien aux forces de sécurité intérieure des pays membres du G5 Sahel (Mali, Mauritanie, Niger, Tchad et Burkina Faso) pour une meilleure redevabilité et prise en compte des droits de l’Homme et du droit international humanitaire dans leurs opérations.
partner_implementing: Danish Institute for Human Rights, The UN Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Make it in the Gambia - Enabel
summary:
The present intervention of Enabel shall be implemented in three years in The Gambia. It is part of larger program aiming at contributing to socio-economic development and to nurture positive prospects for local populations and returning migrants in the Gambia involving other development agencies, including IMVF and GIZ, covering all The Gambia territory. 
Enabel’s intervention will work in the North Bank Region and the Central River Region, focusing on the rehabilitation/ building of structuring economic investments in the agriculture sector, supporting sustainable production, increased productivity and value addition by private actors in selected food value chains. It will also facilitate the development of sustainable management systems and upgrade TVET facilities in both Regions.

title: Support in the implementation of South Sudan's East African Community (EAC) provisions
summary:
The Republic of South Sudan (RSS) was admitted as a full Member of the East African Community on October 1st, 2016. Membership in the Regional Bloc was attained following several months of difficult Technical-Level Negotiations that assessed the development of South Sudan Government’s policies and programmes in a range of areas including, among other, in economic, financial, trade, environment, education and health spheres. This was despite the very difficult internal environment related to an on-going internal strife and the resultant severe economic and humanitarian crisis prevailing in the country. 
South Sudan’s Membership in the Regional Bloc is a somewhat unique development. Never before in the world’s economic history has a country with such short history of independence, with such limited human development and suffering such significant political, security and economic turmoil has joined a Regional Integration Bloc that is as advanced. Membership in the EAC entails the establishment of a Customs Union, a Common Market and a Monetary Union. As such it may be the largest single reform process that the Government of South Sudan has so far committed to undertake. EAC areas of cooperation are wide ranging and include common laws, institutions and harmonization of economic, education or health policies. By signing the Treaty of Accession to the EAC South Sudan Government made a legally binding commitment to implement business friendly policies, improve governance and external accountability and undertake an extensive Regional Integration agenda.
As a result the East African Community opens a somewhat unique opportunity for promotion of democratic, governance and economic reforms through a Regional Integration process that takes place within the larger East Africa Region. South Sudan is now required to accept the fundamental principles of the Community which include peaceful co-existence and good neighbourliness, peaceful settlement of disputes, good governance, de

CRRF DIRECT - Displacement responses through  regional cooperation and technical exchange
summary:
This action will support the implementation of the objectives of the Comprehensive Refugee Response Framework (CRRF) in relation to displacement from the Great Lakes region, which affects the region itself as well as the wider Horn of Africa.

In October 2021, a top-up of €4 million to this action was approved to support UNHCR operations for the voluntary return and reintegration of Burundian refugees currently settled in Rwanda, Tanzania and the Democratic Republic of Congo. This addition will expand the current regional Common Refugee Response Framework (CRRF) action and, with support to an NGO consortium, it will further respond to the immediate needs of returnees and host communities.

title: Better Migration Management Programme Phase II
summary: The second phase of the Better Migration Management programme aims to improve the management of safe, orderly and regular migration in the region and support national authorities in addressing the smuggling of migrants and the trafficking in human beings within and from the Horn of Africa.

title: Promoting stability and strengthening basic service delivery for host communities, refugees and other displaced population in Gambella Regional State of Ethiopia
summary:
The Gambella region hosts more than half of the refugees in Ethiopia and the presence of refugees plays a significant role in relations to the wider political and economic life, bringing about a lot of complexity in the relations between refugees and the local population. This action will contribute to promoting stability and strengthening basic social service delivery for host communities, refugees and other displaced population in the Gambella Regional State of Ethiopia by improving health services for all in four pilot areas and by promoting peace-building, conflict prevention and reconciliation in the region.

In December 2021, the action received a €5 million top-up considering the various needs identified in the target area.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Stability and socio-economic development for vulnerable and marginalised communities in the Tigray region of Ethiopia
summary: This project aims to contribute to promoting stability and reconciliation, socio-economic development and greater self-reliance, in the Tigray region of Ethiopia. It will take a two-pronged approach with investments, on the one hand, in addressing local conflict and building social cohesion and, on the other in enhancing and diversifying livelihoods opportunities for local communities.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: OutReach – Support to education of children and young people in South Sudan, in particular in hard to reach areas
summary: In support of the September 2018 revitalised peace agreement, this project will contribute to strengthening the education sector in hard to reach areas in South Sudan. It aims to increase the primary and secondary education opportunities for 87,500 children in hard to reach areas of South Sudan by motivating and assisting teachers trough training and incentives, and by strengthening public education governance, policy development and human resources information management.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Support to health services in South Sudan (Health Pooled Fund 3 and COVID-19 response)
summary:
This action builds on previous EU engagement in the health sector of South Sudan, via global health initiatives and through the Health Pooled Funds (I and II). Despite the recent signature of the revitalised peace agreement, the basic health needs of the South Sudanese population remain largely unaddressed. By promoting better health for everyone, this project will support the implementation of the peace agreement, reconstruction efforts and the return of internally displaced people (IDPs) and people who fled conflict to neighbouring countries. The action will do so by supporting the foundations of an effective public health system that will deliver improved access to quality health services in South Sudan, and respond to emergency needs where required.

In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, two top-ups of €4 million and €1 million respectively to this action was approved in March 2020.

To further counter COVID-19, another top-up of €2 million was approved in October 2020, specifically for scaling up the provision of personal protection equipment  (PPE)  and  protection  of  health  and  humanitarian  personnel  from  infectious  diseases. This was followed by a fourth top-up of €1.8 million in February 2021.

​
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Humanitarian Development Peace Nexus: Strengthening a Decentralized Health System for protracted displaced populations in North and South Darfur (HealthPro)
summary: This project is prepared on the basis of the EU humanitarian-development-peace Nexus Action approach in Sudan. It promotes durable solutions for displacement-affected communities and access to quality health services in target localities in North and South Darfur strengthening the different building blocks of the decentralised health system. It brings together experienced humanitarian and development cooperation actors (GOAL and the Italian Development Cooperation), building upon the experience of similar approach implemented in West Darfur.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: BRICK Building resilient communities in West Kordofan -Concern
summary:
This action ‘Building Resilient Communities in West Kordofan (BRICK)’ is designed by Concern Worldwide and the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund (UNCIEF) in collaboration with the relevant State Ministries in West Kordofan. In collaboration with UNICEF and a local national NGO partner , to be selected during the inception period will implement the action over three years. The action falls under the EU Trust Fund objective 2, Valetta Action plan priority domains 1 and3, and Sustainable Development Goal 1-6 and 15  and supports the long term national strategy and policy system related priorities 
The overall objective of the proposed project is to strengthen communities’ resilience to shocks and stresses, especially the most vulnerable households, within Abyei-Muglad, Keilak and Meriam localities by achieving the following outcomes:
1.	Improved nutritional and health status of the population particularly of women, adolescent girls and children under five,
2.	Improved enrolment and retention of school aged children especially girls in school, 
3.	Improved income and food & nutrition security of the most vulnerable households especially women headed households  nexus
Since the beginning of the refugee’s influx into West Kordofan in 2016, Concern Worldwide and UNICEF have received emergency funding from ECHO. The interventions focused on restoring access to education, providing lifesaving health and nutritional services, and improving access to WASH to communities affected by the conflict. This action will build on the current, and previous interventions funded by ECHO, with a particular focus on the humanitarian and development peace nexus, gradually moving the responses into the early recovery and development phase. This action will work to build people’s ability to plan for, mitigate and recover from shocks and stresses cognisant of the ongoing vulnerability to conflict in which additional humanitarian support may be required.
The proposed action

title: BRICK Building resilient communities in West Kordofan - UNICEF
summary:
West Kordofan state has one of the lowest indicators across multiple dimensions, including education, health and nutrition, sanitation, and food security. One fifth of the over 1.5 million people (including Internally Displaced Persons - IDPs) in the state are estimated to be food insecure. The low levels of access to health and nutrition services, poor hygiene and sanitation practices, and the lack of adequate access to Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) facilities in schools and health centres contributes to the high under-five mortality burden in the state (20 per cent higher than the national average). With over 156,000 children of school-age out-of-school; and 43.6 per cent of children at grade three not able to read; access to quality education is a challenge. The already extremely vulnerable host communities are hosting thousands of IDPs and refugees thus putting additional strain on already insufficient services (water, health care, etc.); which is further compounded by seasonal migrations of pastoralist communities.

UNICEF’s interventions in West Kordofan are based on the recognition that a considerable proportion of the population in the state have inadequate access to proper sanitation and hygiene services and are therefore prone to water and sanitation-related diseases, with children under-five being especially vulnerable. The situation is further aggravated by low or no access to health and nutrition services as well as quality education. By improving the nutritional and health status of vulnerable people, their food security and their access to primary education, the project will increase women, men, girls’ and boy’s ability to cope and create communities that are more resilient and less likely to resort to migration in the face of crisis. 

Building resilient communities in West Kordofan (BRICK) is an EU-funded intervention to be implemented by the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) and Concern International. The project plans to build on the

title: Contribution au financement de l’Unité de Coordination de l’Alliance (UCA) Sahel
summary:
Le projet vise à appuyer le développement et à la mise en œuvre de réponses efficaces et rapides aux phénomènes d’instabilité, d’insécurité, de déficit de développement et de migrations irrégulières dans l’espace sahélien. Créée en juillet 2017, l’Alliance Sahel regroupe aujourd’hui douze partenaires au développement, engagés à appuyer les pays du G5 Sahel, à travers une approche intégrée et coordonnée portant à la fois sur la sécurité, la stabilisation et le développement à court, moyen et long terme. L’Alliance Sahel vise à améliorer la rapidité et l’efficacité de l’aide fournie par les bailleurs, en particulier dans les zones fragiles, grâce à une meilleure coordination des interventions, l’adoption de modes de faire plus souples et innovants et une responsabilité partagée avec les pays du G5 Sahel.   

La gouvernance de l’Alliance Sahel est organisée autour de 2 instances au sein desquelles sont représentés l’ensemble des membres : 1) une Assemblée générale qui fixe les grandes orientations politiques et stratégiques et 2) un comité de pilotage opérationnel chargé de mettre en œuvre les décisions prises au sein de l’Assemblée générale. Ces deux instances s’appuient sur l’UCA basée à Bruxelles et chargée d’assurer le secrétariat général de l’Assemblée générale en assurant la coordination des membres et des activités. Pour effectuer son mandat, l’Unité de Coordination de l’Alliance (UCA) bénéficie de moyens dédiés qui seront financés dans le cadre de cette action.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Programme d’Appui au G5 pour la Sécurité au Sahel (PAGS) Phase II
summary: L'Union européenne s'est engagée à soutenir le G5 Sahel dans son entreprise de coopération pour une meilleure gestion des frontières et une réponse commune aux grandes menaces transfrontalières auxquelles les cinq pays de la région doivent faire face comme le terrorisme et le crime organisé. Dans cet esprit, la présente action vise à soutenir le renforcement des capacités du Secrétariat Permanent du G5 Sahel dans les domaines prioritaires de dialogue, de concertation et de coordination, notamment en matière de gestion des frontières et de la sécurité, et à apporter un appui technique et pédagogique au Collège Sahélien de Sécurité et à l’Académie Régionale de Police.Le projet PAGS 2 fait suite à un premier projet de 7 millions d’EUR (projet d’appui au G5S pour la Sécurité au Sahel) mis en œuvre sur la période Août 2016 – Septembre 2019 dont les résultats ont été jugés pleinement satisfaisants par l’ensemble des parties prenantes.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation Chad, EU Delegation Mauritania, EU Delegation Mali, EU Delegation Niger, EU Delegation Burkina Faso
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Appui au Développement Economique Local et à la prévention des conflits dans les régions de Tombouctou et Gao (ADEL)
summary: Le projet d’Appui au Développement Economique Local et à la prévention des conflits dans les régions de Tombouctou et Gao (ADEL) s’inscrit dans la continuité des projets de Relance de l’Economie locale et d’Appui aux Collectivités dans le Nord du Mali (RELAC et RELAC II), mis en œuvre par LuxDev entre janvier 2016 et septembre 2019. Le projet ADEL a pour objectif global de contribuer à la stabilisation des régions de Tombouctou et Gao et à la résilience des communautés et des collectivités territoriales.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Boosting green employment and enterprise opportunities in Ghana
summary:
The action aims at supporting job creation in regions of departure, transit and return of Ghana, creating local ecosystems that facilitate the development of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and enabling the transition of local economies to green and climate resilient development. Implementation will take place in the Ashanti and Western region. Ashanti region is one of the main areas of origin of returned migrants whilst Western region is increasingly a location many Ghanaian migrants return to.
 
The action will channel finance through performance-based grants to selected Metropolitan, Municipal and District Assemblies (MMDAs) in Ghana. In close collaboration with communities, it will help them develop and implement green and climate resilient local investments that foster employability for returnees, youth and women through cash for work and procurement to local SMEs.  
 
Simultaneously, the programme will improve skills development for beneficiaries of selected regions, combined with market matching, coaching and mentoring into (self-) employment and enterprise development. In addition, the action will support the incubation and/or acceleration of green and inclusive MSMEs, while also promoting access to finance for returnees, youth, women and MSMEs. This will be done through a market systems approach, and by leveraging remittances for community development and private investment.
partner_implementing: United Nations Capital Development Fund, SNV Netherlands Development Organisation, Ghana
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Strengthening Border Security in Ghana
summary: The project proposes to contribute to reducing irregular migration, by strengthening cooperation at all levels including coordination with neighbouring countries, enhancing border security and by building capacities. This proposal is part of a comprehensive support to the Government of Ghana’s migration policy that seeks “to promote a comprehensive and sustainable approach to migration management which will enhance the potential of migration for Ghana’s development”. The project will particularly support the 2018 – 2022 Ghana's Immigration Service Strategic Plan, which includes among others “contribute to national security by tackling immigration related crimes and detecting and preventing threats at the country’s borders”.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: EU Support to Response, Recovery and Resilience in Borno State
summary: The project’s overarching objective is to provide conflict-affected populations with the means to resume agriculture-based and other environmental-friendly livelihoods, thereby allowing them to progressively sustain their own food and nutritional needs. In doing so, the action will set the foundations for longer-term resilience building and sustainable economic and social development. This will be achieved through the combination of skills development (output1) and productive measures (outputs 2 and 3) supported in the same locations by conditional cash transfers.
