title: IMPACT South Sudan - Mid-term Evaluation
Education in Emergency Programme in Four Former States in South Sudan - WFP
summary:
In South Sudan, there is an urgent need to support schools with interventions for ensuring access to quality education and preventing school abandonment. 
The target beneficiaries will be school-age children attending primary schools in South Sudan (aged 6-18), primary school teachers, school staff, Parent Teacher Associations (PTAs) and the education system in general. School meals help keep children in school during both emergencies and ongoing crises. Other key interventions to ensure access to quality education will include availability of adequate teaching materials and professional training to teachers, focusing on learning achievements. Emphasize will also be placed on the needs of the girl child (i.e. capacity building of teachers on GBV, gender sensitive toilet facilities and dignity kits) with the aim that schools provide a safe and supportive environment for boy and girl pupils alike. This intervention will target 75,000 students.

summary: In South Sudan, there is an urgent need to support schools with interventions for ensuring access to quality education and preventing school abandonment. The target beneficiaries will be school-age children attending primary schools in South Sudan (aged 6-18), primary school teachers, school staff, Parent Teacher Associations (PTAs) and the education system in general. summary: The overall objective of the Monitoring and Learning System is to use an  evidence-based approach for programming and implementing interventions  in the Sahel and Lake Chad region, as well as to inform policy around the  themes of the EUTF in the region

title: Fostering Smallholder Capacities and Access to Markets in Food Insecure Areas of Darfur
summary:
Sudan faces post-harvest losses of approximately 30% across most if not all its staple grain harvests. The impact of this until now ignored ‘enemy’ has an impact on Sudan and its people that rivals even civil conflict. Post-harvest loss impacts the entire country’s economy, but most directly, the 4.2 million smallholder farmers and their families. The WFP Zero Food Loss Initiative, a global effort by WFP to scale successful methods to reduce post-harvest losses, has already had 250,000 farming families participate since 2015. The combination of (1) effective training at the household level, and (2) working with the private sector to build supply chains to ensure consistent, profitable supply of hermetic (airtight) storage is a winning, scalable combination: an independent impact assessment by MIT  found that participating families had increased household incomes and improved food availability in lean seasons, improved nutrition and health, improved sons and daughters schooling, and perhaps most importantly, reduction in woman’s workload and an improvement in their socio-economic status. 
The Zero Food Loss Initiative began its initial rollout in Sudan in 2016 with similar results. WFP’s role is to serve as the catalyst for private sector growth of the hermetic storage industry, to build farmer awareness and spark farmer demand through effective training, and to incentivize profit-driven supply. The goal in Sudan is to incentivize 4.2 million farmers to change their post-harvest practices by 2025, and the development of the private sector supply chains is key to reach this level of market penetration. 
The project concretely addresses some of the main root causes of post-harvest losses, and minimises the economic and social impact that post-harvest losses have on the livelihoods of smallholder farmers and their families in three states of the Darfur region of Sudan.
partner_implementing: World Food Programme (Sudan Office), World Food Programme

title: Somali Stability Fund II – part II
summary:
The theory of change for SSF II pre-supposes that addressing the political fault-lines for contestation and conflict identified in SSF’s Analysis (Output 1) should be at the centre of any strategy to build stability in Somalia. This will be through support to:
1. Enhanced popular participation, particularly for women and excluded groups in order to promote broader voice, empowerment and accountability in the longer-term and avoid locking in exclusion that could lead to longer-term instability
2. A range of interventions which increase government visibility and community engagement around key priorities such as services and livelihood opportunities .
3. SSF will further support targeted conflict resolution processes - working in partnership with the state authorities far as possible as the best way of ensuring sustainability

title: Wadi El Ku Integrated Catchment Management Project (Phase 2)
summary:
The second phase of UN Environment’s Wadi El Ku Catchment Management Project will continue to demonstrate how effective and inclusive natural resource management, based on UN Environment’s experience in Sudan of Integrated Water Resources Management and Community-Based Natural Resource Management, can improve relationships over natural resources, therefore contributing to peace in a conflict affected region of Sudan, and improve livelihoods through enabling sustainable increases in agriculture and related value chain productivity. Participating communities will achieve sustainable increases in agricultural and related value-chain production through the rehabilitation and improved management of land, forest and water resources. UN Environment’s convening power will continue to bring communities and disparate sectoral institutions together to rebuild relationships over natural resources, thereby contributing to peace. The intent is to refine and strengthen the model for inclusive and effective catchment management developed under Phase 1, which demonstrated a positive impact on the environment and livelihoods, as well as on relationships over resources. This model can be scaled up and replicated elsewhere in Darfur and Sudan. 
The project will achieve this outcome by applying UN Environment’s knowledge and experience with environmental governance and integrated water resource management to the natural resource management challenges of Wadi El Ku. Concretely, the project will continue to grow and refine a catchment management system in the project area, which brings government and communities together for joint decision making over natural resources. The project will also take actions that open up and improve livelihood options and practices for farmers, agro-pastoralists and pastoralists living in or migrating through Wadi El Ku near El Fasher.  It will help these communities to better manage their soil, water and forest resources, and to address the growing soil eros

title: Favoriser la mise en œuvre de la stratégie nationale migratoire en Tunisie (Composante 1)
summary:
L'objectif principal de ce projet est de renforcer la gouvernance en matière de gestion des migrations, au travers d'une approche multisectorielle, basée sur des évidences.
L'objectif spécifique 1 se concentre ainsi sur le renforcement du dialogue, des capacités et de la coopération intersectorielle pour une meilleure gouvernance de la migration. Tandis que l'objectif spécifique 2 vise à renforcer la coordination entre acteurs statistiques des migrations et à faciliter la conception de l'enquête du MED-HIMS appliquée à la Tunisie. Le but de l'enquête est de fournir aux analystes de la conjoncture économique, aux décideurs politiques et aux autres parties prenantes en Tunisie des informations détaillées sur les déterminants et les conséquences des migrations, afin de les aider à mieux cibler les politiques migratoires et l'aide au développement. L'objectif 3 vise à renforcer la coordination et coopération inter-composante et à harmoniser la communication du programme ProGreS (composé de 4 composantes mis en œuvre par 8 agences d'exécution).

title: From Surviving to Thriving - Strengthening Resilience of Vulnerable Households and Communities in Northern Somalia
summary:
The Theory of Change is based on a “Push/Pull” strategy. The Action aims to equip market-oriented value chain actors with business skills and training that increase their capacity to engage more productively in demand-driven economic opportunities in partnership with other public and private market actors to transition out of low skill, assets, capital and access to markets, and thus low resilience.  Moreover, the Action aims to strengthen social protection and self-help mechanisms.  
The Action contains “Push” activities to strengthen household, group, community capacities to prepare for, mitigate against and respond to shocks, strengthen networks of self-help, and skills to diversify incomes, increase productivity and enhance self-reliance.
The Action supports a number of “Pull” activities to improve understanding of the capacity-based constraints of the most vulnerable and inclusiveness of opportunities nurtured. Barriers for market entry for both individuals and households will be lowered through (i) the strengthening and development of risk-sharing mechanisms (iii) strengthening of input networks (CAHWs, and agri-vets); (iii) building-the-chain through support to mid-level value-chain entrepreneurs through loans, grants, linkages to formal financial institutions and promotion of marketing through collectives to break supply chain bottle necks; (iv) creating new types of jobs in value chains, public sector or new sector; (v) introducing innovative governance mechanisms.
partner_funding: Danish Refugee Council, SIDA, World Vision Australia, CARE NEDERLAND, Action Contre la Faim, ADRA
location_code: SO-AW, SO-SA, SO-BR, SO-NU, SO-SO, SO-WO,

title: Self-reliance of South Sudanese refugees in DRC
summary: The project targets South Sudanese refugees in Haut-Uélé and Ituri province in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and the need to ensure their protection. This includes access to adequate settlement areas and services as well as opportunities for self-reliance and in a way that mutually benefits and enhances the peaceful-coexistence with local, host communities and ensures that there is no deleterious impact to the neighboring Garamba National Park, a World Heritage Site.

title: Autonomisation et épanouissement des réfugiés via l'éducation, l'accès aux services de protection sociale et les opportunités économiques

title: Enhancing self-reliance for refugees and host communities in Kenya
summary:
The aim of this project is to enhance the self-reliance of refugees and host communities in Kenya.

In December 2019, a top-up of €7.6 million was approved in order to extend the support to the Kalobeyei Integrated Social and Economic Development Plan (KISEDP), by piloting the insertion of refugees in the national medical health coverage system in Kakuma and Kalobeyei and building much needed infrastructure, including schools and boarding facilities and transport linkages. It will also support the development of an integrated health facility of the Dadaab refugee camp that will service both refugees and host populations.

In order to support increased food security via the World Food Programme’s (WFP) presence in the Kalobeyei settlement in Kenya, a top-up of €5 million was approved in October 2021. These additional funds will not only ensure WFP’s unrestricted cash transfers for an additional 4.5 months, but also extend the current support to programmes related to school feeding and nutrition prevention. This top-up will further complement the self-reliance-oriented activities in the Kalobeyei settlement.

In December 2021, the action received a top-up of €2.8 million to contribute to the further implementation of the KISEDP for refugees and host communities in Turkana County.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Security, Protection, and Economic Empowerment (SUPREME)
summary: This project aims to improve overall safety and economic well-being for refugees and host communities in Northern Uganda.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Promoting Inclusive Urban Development in Assosa town, Ethiopia
summary:
This action aims to provide direct support to Assosa urban area, in the Benishangul Gumuz region (BGRS), with severely stressed or pre-existing low coverage of basic services and potentials for a high concentration of displaced population.

The action thus seeks to address these gaps and ultimately contribute to increasing the safety and well-being of displaced populations (refugees, IDPs, migrants) and their host communities living in urban or peri-urban settings around Assosa and reduce inequalities and tensions between these groups. 

The intervention logic holds that by supporting the municipality to improve urban planning and service provision and through the creation of spaces for communal dialogue, living conditions and opportunities for the local and displaced populations, including refugees and stranded migrants, will improve and the risk of conflicts over scarce resources will be reduced, resulting in greater well-being and safety.

This will be reinforced through the regional component by establishing peer networks and a platform for dialogue across key stakeholders, notably municipalities, to promote innovation, learning and the adoption of best practices

title: Integrating refugee children into the Sudanese Education System
summary:
This project will improve basic education services in Sudan. It will do so comprehensively by integrating other sectors in the education intervention in schools, i.e. health, WASH, child protection and nutrition.

A €15 million top-up to the action was also approved in July 2021, bringing the total to €25 million. The additional funds to be delegated to UNICEF will allow to expand: 1) the geographical target to all South Darfur and South Kordofan States (instead of the 4 localities initially planned); 2) the target groups from 20,000 beneficiaries, to 20,000 children from refugee and host communities (including IDPs), 5,000 nomads and 100,000 students for remedial programme; 3) the number of teachers, school management staff and community members targeted; and 4) the number of children and adolescents benefitting from participation in children and youth clubs. In addition, activities to improve the Education Management Information System in Sudan to provide better data and information for planning and programming are also proposed. An additional focus will be put on quality education with the provision of technical assistance to introduce classroom learning assessment and improvement activities. Furthermore, remedial education will be provided to address the learning loss due to COVID-19 and school closures in 2020.

title: EU support for the Family Support Programme and for the consolidation of social protection in Sudan
summary:
The aim of this Action is to support the Government of Sudan to mitigate the impact of the global COVID-19 pandemic within the context of its ongoing economic reforms.

The Government of Sudan is soliciting donor support to gear up short-term social assistance through a Family Support Programme (FSP), which it views as a central fact of its response to COVID-19, and as a foundation for its future long-term social protection system.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Building Resilient Communities in West Kordofan (BRICK)
summary: The BRICK programme plans to build on the interventions currently supported by DG ECHO in three localities (Meriam, Abyei-Muglad, and Keilak) of West Kordofan by providing comprehensive multi-sectoral integrated intervention comprising health and nutrition, education, WASH and livelihood for the most vulnerable households and communities.
partner_funding: UNICEF, EU Trust Fund for Africa
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Towards a Holistic Approach to Labour Migration Governance and Labour Mobility in North Africa
summary: The programme will contribute to improving the governance of labour migration and the protection of migrant workers in the North of Africa by supporting the development and implementation of coherent and comprehensive policy frameworks guided by relevant human rights and labour standards and based on reliable data and evidence. These are essential for fair and effective labour migration governance and decent work. In addition, it will contribute to preparing, putting in place or improving legal migration and mobility schemes in cooperation with selected North African countries – Egypt, Morocco and Tunisia – and EU Member States, initially Germany and Belgium. Other EU MS might participate at a later stage.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, Bundesministerium fur wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Egypt, EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Tunisia
partner_implementing: ENABEL - Belgian Development Agency, International Organization for Migration, OIT - ILO - Organisation Internationale du Travail - International Labour Organization, GIZ
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Support to Integrated border and migration management in Libya - Second phase
summary: The Overall Objective of the programme is to develop the overall capacity of the relevant Libyan authorities and strengthen institutional reform in the areas of land and sea border control and surveillance; addressing smuggling and trafficking of human beings; Search & Rescue at sea (SAR); and on land contributing to a human response of the migration crises in respect of international and human right laws.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Mission d'appui aux acteurs du programme de renforcement de la résilience à l'insécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle au Nord mali (Key)
summary: Le programme Key qui a été lancé en cofinancement par l'EUTF et le Fond FED (Décision PRORESA) a pour objectif d'améliorer la résilience des populations les plus vulnérables du Nord et du centre du Mali. Les activités de ce grand programme sont mises en oeuvre par 5 grands consortia dont 3 sont soutenus par l'EUTF (T05-EUTF-SAH-ML-01-01; T05-EUTF-SAH-ML-01-02; T05-EUTF-SAH-ML-01-03). Toutefois, les interventions de ces consortias sont limitées aux aspects opérationnels terrain. Il a semblé nécessaire de compléter l'architecture existente avec le financement d'un marché de service pour les aspects communs traités au niveau interconsortias. Ainsi, ce projet de l'URD tend à répondre à ce besoin de coordination.

title: Soutien à la gestion intégrée des frontières et de la migration au Maroc
summary: L’objectif général du programme, conformément à l’objectif stratégique no.5 du cadre opérationnel du Fonds fiduciaire de l’UE pour le nord de l’Afrique (ci-après dénommé le « cadre opérationnel »), est d’atténuer les vulnérabilités liées à la migration irrégulière et de lutter contre la migration irrégulière. L’action vise à renforcer les capacités des institutions marocaines à protéger, surveiller et contrôler les frontières conformément à l’approche humaniste de la SNIA.
partner_implementing: Fundación Internacional y para Iberoamérica de Administración y Políticas Públicas
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Déploiement des Politiques Migratoires au Niveau Régional
summary: L’objectif général de l'action est de «renforcer la gouvernance et la mise en oeuvre des politiques migratoires au niveau régional». Elle vise plus spécifiquement l'intégration des deux politiques migratoires que sont la Stratégie nationale d'immigration et d'asile (SNIA) et la Stratégie Nationale en faveur des marocains résidant à l'étranger (SNMRE) dans le développement local au Maroc au profit à la fois des marocains résidant à l'étranger et des migrants régularisés au Maroc et ce, dans trois régions pilotes que sont les régions de Beni Mellal-Khénifra, de l’Oriental et du Souss-Massa. Dans ces régions, l'action intervient avec des activités d'intégration des politiques migratoires au niveau régional et le renforcement des capacités des régions. Les activités relatives au renforcement de capacité concerneront aussi la région de Tanger-Tétouan-Al Hoceima.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Disrupting criminal trafficking and smuggling networks through increased anti-money laundering and financial investigation capacity in the Greater Horn of Africa
summary: This project is a regional intervention covering eight countries in the Greater Horn of Africa (Djibouti, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Kenya, Somalia, South Sudan, Sudan, Uganda, Yemen and Tanzania.) The aim of the project is to disrupt cross-border criminal organisations profiting from irregular migration, human trafficking and other types of organised crime by focusing on their financial resources.
location_code: DJ, ET, KE, SO, SS, SS, UG, YE
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Erasmus+ in West Africa and the Horn of Africa
summary:
In the framework of the Valletta Summit in November 2015, European and African leaders discussed the European migration situation. The Summit resulted in the adoption of a Political Declaration and Action Plan ensuring, among others priorities, the substantial increase of the number of scholarships for African students and academic staff through the EU supported Erasmus+ programme. 

In order to further support the ongoing ERASMUS+ programme and increase the availability of trained and qualified high-level professional manpower in West Africa and the Horn of Africa, this action will support the mobility of 2,200 students and university staff between Europe and African partner countries. 

This will contribute to improving the capacities, quality, and international dimension of institutions and further support the skills and employability of youth.
Building on existing practices and mechanisms under Erasmus+, the action will further complement the already ongoing support from the EUTF for the Sahel and Lake Chad (T05-EUTF-REG-SAH-10) and enlarge the geographical scope. This action as the previous one will finance additional mobility flows for targeted countries, as opposed to creating a brand new action.

For more information on the first ERASMUS+ programme in West Africa, please refer to: https://ec.europa.eu/trustfundforafrica/region/sahel-lake-chad/regional/erasmus-west-africa_en
partner_accountable: EU Delegation Burkina Faso, EU Delegation Cameroon, EU Delegation Cabo Verde, EU Delegation Guinea-Bissau, EU Delegation Mali, EU Delegation Mauritania, EU Delegation Niger, EU Delegation Nigeria, EU Delegation Senegal, EU Delegation Djibouti, EU Delegation Ethiopia, EU Delegation Eritrea, EU Delegation Kenya, EU Delegation Somalia, EU Delegation South Sudan, EU Delegation Sudan, EU Delegation Tanzania, EU Delegation Uganda, EU Delegation Ivory Coast, EU Delegation Gambia, EU Delegation Ghana, EU Delegation Guinea, EU Delegation Guinea-Bissau, EU Delegation Mali, EU Delegation Mauritania, EU Delegation Niger, EU Delegation Nigeria, EU Delegation Senegal, EU Delegation Djibouti, EU Delegation Ethiopia, EU Delegation Eritrea, EU Delegation Kenya, EU Delegation Somalia, EU Delegation South Sudan, EU Delegation Sudan, EU Delegation Tanzania, EU Delegation Uganda, EU Delegation Ivory Coast, EU Delegation Gambia, EU Delegation Ghana, EU Delegation Guinea
partner_implementing: Directorate General for Education and Culture
recipient_country: BF, BJ, CI, CM, CV, DJ, ER, ET, GH, GM, GN, GW, KE, LR, ML, MR, NE, NG, SD, SL, SN, SO, SS, TD, TG, TZ, UG
location_code: BF, NE, NG, SN, DJ, ET, ER, KE, SO, SS, SD, CM, TZ, UG, TD, CI, GM, GH, GN, ML, MR
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: L’UE pour le nexus sécurité-résilience-développement en Mauritanie
summary: À la charnière de l'Afrique subsaharienne et du Maghreb, la Mauritanie fait face à de nombreux défis sécuritaires. Zone de transit pour les trafics de drogues comme pour les filières d’immigration irrégulière, elle a été aussi le théâtre de plusieurs actes terroristes islamiques entre 2005 et 2011. Ce programme permet de soutenir les autorités mauritaniennes pour faire face au croissant flux migratoire dans le pays et de renforcer les capacités de détection et de protection des migrants en détresse tout en facilitant un appui complémentaire en matière de gestion des finances publiques, de sécurité et de gestion de la migration.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Building Sustainable Peace and Reconciliation in South Sudan
summary: In September 2018 a Revitalised Agreement on the resolution of the conflict in the Republic of South Sudan (R-ARCSS) was signed. This is a step in the right direction towards peace in the country. This project aims to sustain reconciliation initiatives and promote accountability mechanisms and justice.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Supporting the IGAD Secretariat in the area of Peace and Security
summary: To provide IGAD Secretariat with a core team of positions to deliver on the P&S Regional Strategy 2016-2020
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to the African Union (ET

title: Empowerment juridique des personnes migrantes
summary:
Ce projet est mis en œuvre par Enabel, l’agence belge de développement dans le cadre du Fonds Fiduciaire d’Urgence de l’Union européenne en faveur de la stabilité et de la lutte contre les causes profondes de la migration irrégulière et du phénomène des personnes déplacées en Afrique (« Fonds fiduciaire d’Urgence, FFU »). 
L’objectif  général  du  projet  s’aligne  sur  l’objectif  stratégique  3  de  la  matrice  de  résultats  du  FFU  – fenêtre  Afrique  du  Nord,  à  savoir  « Renforcer  la  protection  et  la  résilience  des personnes dans le besoin ». 
Plus spécifiquement, le projet vise à améliorer l’accès des personnes migrantes et réfugiées à leurs droits. Cet objectif correspond à l’objectif spécifique V du FFU qui est : L’accès aux et la qualité des services destinés aux groupes cibles et aux communautés d’accueil sont améliorés. 

Le projet vise à contribuer au renforcement de l’accès aux droits des personnes migrantes en :
1.	Renforçant les connaissances sur les droits des migrants et sur la transmission de l’information au public cible et aux prestataires de service ;
2.	Renforçant les compétences, les services et le travail en réseau des prestataires de services en vue de consolider l’accès effectif des personnes migrantes à leurs droits ;
3.	Renforçant la coordination et la transmission d’informations relatives à l’accès aux droits des personnes migrantes entre les différents acteurs en vue de favoriser l’analyse quant à l’accès aux services et de formuler conjointement des recommandations permettant à terme de renforcer effectivement l’accès aux droits des populations ciblées par le projet.
Le projet est mis en œuvre par Enabel en coordination avec le Ministre Délégué auprès du Ministre des Affaires Etrangères et de la Coopération Internationale Chargé des Marocains Résidant à l’Etranger et des Affaires de la Migration (MDCMREAM) et avec le Ministre de la Justice et des Libertés (MJ).

title: Développement des opportunités d'emploi et d'investissement à travers la mobilisation de la diaspora
summary:
Le renforcement de la contribution spécifiquement des RDT au développement socio-économique du pays à travers l'appui à l'investissement et à la création d'entreprises et d'emplois se fera par le biais de la création d’un dispositif pérenne d’appui à l’entrepreneuriat, qui sera destiné à la création et à l’accompagnement d’entreprises créatrices d’emplois et de développement innovantes / de startups. L’incubateur créé à cet effet doit permettre aux porteurs de projets d’accéder à un service d’accompagnement dans les différentes phases de la création d'entreprises. Des unités régionales de cet incubateur d’accompagnement à la création et à l’incubation avec des espaces de co-working dans plusieurs régions du pays seront également mises en place. Les unités régionales assureront la mise en relation des porteurs de projet avec les autorités locales et les institutions publiques et privés concernées par les projets. 

Parallèlement à la création du dispositif, une plateforme digitale sera créée. Celle-ci devra servir à recueillir, analyser et mettre à disposition des informations pertinentes et fiables sur les possibilités d’investissement dans les secteurs et les régions (cartographie dynamique des opportunités), sur les potentiels des marchés, le cadre légal et les mécanismes d’appui à l’entrepreneuriat. Ces informations seront recueillies au sein de la plateforme digitale dans le but d’orienter les entrepreneurs RDT vers les secteurs où les possibilités d’investissement sont favorables, créatrices de valeur et génératrices d’emploi. Cette plateforme offrira des services de conseil personnalisé, de coaching et de formation aux porteurs de projets à distance, dans le but d’éliminer les contraintes du déplacement et d’offrir aux bénéficiaires l’appui d’une expertise hautement qualifiée, sans barrières géographiques. La plateforme mettra également à disposition un espace virtuel sous forme de réseau social, servant à la mise en relation entre les RDT pour lancer et concr

title: Border Management Programme for the Maghreb region (BMP-Maghreb)
summary:
The Border Management Programme for the Maghreb Region (BMP Maghreb) is a **regional programme** in North Africa (Morocco and Tunisia) within the framework of the European Union Trust Fund for Stability and Combating the Root Causes of Irregular Migration and the Displaced Persons in Africa (EUTF).

The Programme will be implemented by the International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD), an inter-governmental organisation with expertise on migration and border management, with the participation of the Ministry of Interior of Italy for the Tunisian component.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Tunisia

title: Mediterranean City-to-City Migration (MC2CM) – Phase II
summary:
The Mediterranean City-to-City Migration (MC2CM) is a regional programme in North Africa within the framework of the European Union Emergency Trust Fund for Stability and Combating the Root Causes of Irregular Migration and the Displaced Persons in Africa (EUTF). The overall objective of the action is to contribute to fostering rights-based migration governance-systems in the region. 
The three main components of the project are (1) Dialogue; (2) Knowledge and (3) Action and a cross-cutting component of (4) Communications and Awareness-raising. Dialogue is created by connecting cities through a transnational network and delivering targeted peer-to-peer exchange and learnings. This is in turn translated into the local context by involving relevant stakeholders in the identification of migration priorities and implementation of actions. Knowledge is generated by gathering information about the local situation of migration in the targeted cities and using it to assess needs. The knowledge is analysed and extrapolated into a wider context of mobile populations and changing local demographics and policies. The latter components constitute the basis for the development of City Targeted Actions that address identified needs and priorities, providing for long-term solutions to migration challenges and opportunities. Lastly, communications and awareness-raising represent a cross-cutting dimension of all project components. 
This Action responds to the priorities outlined in Pillar 1 (1.1 "Investing in Development and Poverty Eradication" and "Development Benefits of Migration") of The Valletta Action Plan and the Objective 3: Improved migration management in countries of origin and transit of the EUTF, namely sub-Area 1: Migration Governance. Respectively, it directly targets the first priority of the EUTF NoA Operational Framework (i) to contribute to fostering rights-based migration governance-systems in the region.
partner_accountable: EU Delegation to Algeria, EU Delegation to Morocco, EU Delegation to Tunisia, EU Delegation to Libya
recipient_country: DZ, EG, JO, LY, MA, TN

title: Make it in The Gambia - GIZ
summary:
The overall objective of the project "Make it in The Gambia" of which this component is a part is as follows:
to contribute to socio-economic development and to nurture positive prospects for local populations and returning migrants in the Gambia.
The three specific objectives (SO) of the project are the following:
SO.1: To boost economic development with a focus on attractive employment and revenue generation in regions prone to migration. 
SO.2: To promote a conducive socio-economic environment for an effective and sustainable reintegration and to improve the attractiveness of rural areas 
SO.3: To promote the concept: 'tekki fii – Make it Here -Make it in The Gambia'
The GIZ-component will contribute mainly to the SO.1, and indirectly to the SO.3.
The other implementing partners identified for the action “Make it in The Gambia are: the Instituto Marquês de Valle Flôr (IMVF), ENABEL, International Trade Center (ITC).

title: Programme d’urgence pour la stabilisation des espaces frontaliers du G5 Sahel (PDU)
summary: Le présent Programme d’urgence pour la stabilisation des espaces frontaliers du G5 Sahel est une réponse directe à cette demande des Chefs d’Etat du G5 Sahel, élaborée conjointement avec le Secrétariat Permanent du G5 dans le cadre de l’Alliance Sahel avec les contributions de ses membres. Son objectif général est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, la résilience des populations vulnérables et la cohésion sociale à travers notamment l’amélioration de l’accès à l’eau dans les régions les plus fragiles des pays du G5 Sahel.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, Agence Française de Développement
partner_accountable: EU Delegation Mauritania, EU Delegation Chad, EU Delegation Niger, EU Delegation Burkina Faso, EU Delegation Mali
partner_implementing: GIZ, Luxembourg Development Cooperation Agency, Centre pour le dialogue humanitaire - HD, Agence Française de Développement
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework
project_child: T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-01, T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-02, T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-04, T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-07, T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-09, T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-08, T05-EUTF-SAH-REG-18-06

title: La voix des jeunes du Sahel - Dialogue entre jeunes et institutions au Sahel (phase II)
summary:
Ce projet s’aligne avec la Stratégie Intégrée de la Jeunesse du G5 Sahel dans le cadre du Programme d’Investissements Prioritaires (PIP), visant l’appui à l’intégration des organisations de jeunesse dans les processus d’élaboration et de mise en œuvre des politiques de développement en leur faveur. Cela inclue des activités de soutien au G5 Sahel dans la finalisation de sa Stratégie Intégrée de la Jeunesse et l’élaboration et suivi de son Plan d’action. 

Le projet permettra de donner une voix politique forte à la jeunesse innovatrice et moderne en contribuant à la pérennisation d’espaces de dialogue locaux, nationaux et régional ouverts en 2017 à travers les pays du G5 Sahel, dans le cadre de la première phase du projet « La Voix des jeunes du Sahel ». Ces espaces de dialogue ont permis de mobiliser 1250 représentants d’organisations de jeunesse pour les muer en force motrice de leur propre insertion.
partner_funding: EU Trust Fund for Africa, Ministry of Foreign Affairs Denmark
partner_accountable: EU Delegation Burkina Faso, EU Delegation Mali, EU Delegation Niger, EU Delegation Mauritania, EU Delegation Chad
partner_implementing: Centre pour le dialogue humanitaire - HD
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Stabilisation et renforcement socio-économique des populations affectées par la migration irrégulière dans les zones de transit au Niger
summary: Compte tenu du développement de nouvelles routes vers la Méditerranée et de l'afflux de migrants et nigériens à partir des pays voisins, des mesures supplémentaires seront mises en œuvre pour soutenir davantage la gestion de la migration et la gouvernance au Niger. En particulier, l'action proposée complétera, dans des zones ciblées, l'approche globale existante mise en œuvre jusqu'ici au Niger en atténuant l'impact de la migration sur les communautés de transit et en soutenant davantage les alternatives économiques auprès des populations qui vivaient auparavant du trafic et des activités illégales lié à la migration.
partner_implementing: Haute Autorité à la Consolidation de la Paix - HACP
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Partenariat Opérationnel Conjoint (POC) de lutte contre l’immigration irrégulière, la traite et le trafic de migrants au Sénégal
summary:
En vue de contribuer à la lutte contre les réseaux criminels liés au trafic de migrants au Sénégal, les actions menées dans le cadre de ce projet fourniront un appui aux ministères concernés par cette thématique. Le renforcement de la coopération interministérielle doublé d’une montée en compétence des différents bureaux de la division nationale de lutte contre le trafic de migrant (DNLTM) et des pratiques assimilées, constitueront les axes majeurs de l’action. Ce projet prend le nom de Partenariat Opérationnel Conjoint (POC), témoignant par là du caractère approfondi de la coopération du Sénégal et des Etats membres de l'UE, associés dans la lutte contre l'immigration irrégulière, le trafic de migrants et la traite d'êtres humains.
Ainsi, les activités proposées s’inscriront dans la continuité des actions entreprises par le gouvernement sénégalais, en créant des synergies entre administrations impliquées et en améliorant l’intégration de la DNLTM dans le dispositif sécuritaire sénégalais, et, par extension, régional.
project_parent: EU Trust Fund for Africa Results Framework

title: Community Resilience In Somaliland & Puntland (CRISP)
summary: The CRISP project will start with a 4-month inception phase, during which staff recruitment, start-up activities and major procurements for Year 1 will be done. Staff of all five consortium members will be (re-)trained in the approaches and techniques required for this project, for example the Climate Adapted Village (CAV) approach, gender equality, group facilitation techniques (incl VSL), climate change and DRR. Finance training will be done to ensure that all partners are familiar with the requirements and demands for this project.  During the inception phase, the exact villages/communities in which the project will work will be confirmed , and beneficiary numbers adjusted accordingly, in consultation with the donor. Further consultations with all key stakeholders to the project, particularly the government structures in both locations, will be undertaken. These discussions will lead to the signing of MoUs between the consortium members and the relevant institutions like Ministry of Environment and Climate Change (Puntland), Ministry of Environment and Rural Planning (Somaliland), NEDFOR and HADMA. The CRISP project will contribution to national priorities highlighted in National Development Plan (NDP ll) and Somaliland vision 2030 for Somaliland, and for the Revised Puntland Development Plan for Puntland. The National Somalia Drought Impact & Needs Assessment (DINA) has many priorities that are overlapping with the CRISP project, hence the project will contribute to address these challenges. This goes for both Somaliland and Puntland. Relevant actors to the interventions, such as companies for borehole drilling, dam excavation, solar panel provision and market outlets for products like honey will be assessed and evaluated for the inclusion of the project. The inception phase will culminate with the baseline survey data collection and analysis. Following the inception phase, the locally tailored package of interventions will be implemented over 36 months (3 years

title: Response to increased demand on Government Service and creation of economic opportunities in Uganda (RISE) - GIZ
summary:
The overall objective is, in line with the Common Refugee Response Framework (CRRF) and the Refugee and Host Population Empowerment (ReHoPE) Strategy for Uganda, to strengthen local authorities in delivering government services to and create economic opportunities for all people in the refugee-hosting districts and thus, to enable greater resilience and self-reliance among both refugee and host communities. The specific objectives are 1) to strengthen local authorities' coordination and development planning, as well as local authority-led service delivery to refugees and the host populations and 2) to increase economic self-reliance of refugees and host populations.

This component of the RISE programme, implemented by GIZ, has the following specific objectives are 1) to strengthen local authorities' coordination and development planning, as well as local authority-led service delivery to refugees and the host populations and 2) to increase economic self-reliance of refugees and host populations.

title: Mid-term Evaluation of RDPP Support to the Development of Kalobeyei Settlement
summary:
The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union and the interested stakeholders with:
•	An overall independent assessment of the medium-term performance of the Regional Development and Protection Programme in Kenya: Support to the Kalobeyei Development Programme, paying attention to its intermediate results measured against its objectives, in particular in relation to the goal of socio-economic integration of refugees and host communities in and around Kalobeyei in the pursuit of a more development-oriented approach to addressing displacement;
•	Key lessons and recommendations in order to improve the successful implementation of the Action. This may include a reorientation and/or review of the specific objectives and activities of the Action as appropriate. 
•	Orientations for future support to further operationalising joint-up approaches of EU instruments towards forced displacement, and specifically, in the framework of the EU Trust Fund, towards the roll-out of the Comprehensive Refugee Response Framework in Kenya.

title: GAR-SI SAHEL (Groupes d’Action Rapides – Surveillance et Intervention au Sahel) - Niger
partner_implementing: Fundación Internacional y para Iberoamérica de Administración y Políticas Públicas

title: GAR-SI SAHEL (Groupes d’Action Rapides – Surveillance et Intervention au Sahel) - Mali
